1:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Charles Darwin

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Brother to Blackbeard, impressively made all at Navan, drops back to 5f, can follow up
runners.spotlight: No Nay Never colt is a brother to Group 1 winner Blackbeard; built on the promise of his Curragh debut (5f, good) when making all in a 6f Navan maiden (soft) in very impressive fashion; the drop back to 5f should pose no problems here and a 3lb penalty may not stop him from following up en-route to a trip to Royal Ascot.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Charles Darwin is a lovely, big, powerful and strong horse and we always thought was an Ascot horse. He was very green at the Curragh and the race was a bit messy, and he did everything right today. He travelled and quickened very well. He's not short of speed, so it will be the Coventry or Norfolk for him at Royal Ascot - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Fresh Fade
runners.comment: Cotai Glory colt, half-brother won at 1m2f, dam won at 1m1f, newcomer may need further
runners.spotlight: Cotai Glory colt sold for 60,000Euros as a yearling and 55,000GNS as a 2yo; third foal; half-brother to 1m2f AW winner Rock Armour (RPR 68); dam 1m1f winner (80), half-sister to 7f Group 3 winner Empowering, out of 7f Listed winning half-sister to 7f-1m1f Group 1 winner Bigstone; newcomer from respected source but pedigree suggests he may need further.

runners.name: Jack The Bachelor
runners.comment: Mehmas colt, half-brother to three 2yo winners, plenty of appeal on paper, check market
runners.spotlight: Mehmas colt was a 65,000Euros yearling and 100,000GBP 2yo; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Markaz Paname (6f/7f inc 2yo/Group 3; RPR 109), Latin Fever (7f 2yo; 79) and On Tick (5f AW 2yo; 74); dam 5f winner (inc AW; 77), out of half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 1 winner Elusive City; appeals on paper and worth a market check for in form yard.

runners.name: Sir Alfie
runners.comment: Dark Angel colt, dam a half-sister to Territories, yard can ready one but may need further
runners.spotlight: Dark Angel colt cost 75,000GNS as a yearling; second foal; dam unraced half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Territories, out of Listed-placed 1m/1m1f 2yo winner, is granddaughter of 15.5f Group 3 winner; yard can ready one first time up but pedigree suggests he'll be seen to best effect over further.

runners.name: Cardiff By The Sea
runners.owner: C Bernick & P J Obrien & Mrs P Shanahan & M Oflynn
runners.comment: Well-bred St Mark's Basilica filly, bought for 320,000GNS at breeze ups, go well on debut
runners.spotlight: St Mark's Basilica filly bought for 320,000GNS at the Craven breeze-up sales last month; second foal; half-sister to 6f/7f winner Al Qudra (inc AW/2yo Listed; RPR 107); dam 5f 2yo winner (inc Listed; 98), half-sister to useful 6f-1m winner Magical Dreamer; attractive pedigree and could go well on debut.

runners.name: Spring Is Here
runners.comment: Starspangledbanner filly ran a fine race in listed company on debut, looks the main danger
runners.spotlight: Starspangledbanner filly cost 225,000Euros as a yearling; sister to 2yo Group 3 winner Castle Star ran a fine race in a listed contest at the Curragh on debut (5f, good) when 25-1, beaten just 2.5l into fourth of 6; should improve plenty for that initial experience and may give the Ballydoyle horse most to think about.

2:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Monasterboice
runners.comment: Won three in a row last summer, should not be judged too harshly on Irish Lincoln run
runners.spotlight: Reeled off a hat-trick last July/August and better again in defeat in a conditions event at Galway in September; later struggled in testing ground at Leopardstown; handles an ease but not suited by heavy going in the Irish Lincoln on reappearance; unwise to rule out in this grade.

runners.name: Grey Leader
runners.comment: Won on the first of two starts at last year's Galway festival, lacks a recent outing
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner with three of his victories gained two seasons ago; got a well-judged ride from the front when winning a Galway festival handicap over an extended 1m last August; found 7f inadequate when fifth under a penalty three days later; absent since.

runners.name: Independent Expert
runners.comment: Won twice last year, respectable seventh in Irish Lincoln, excuses for Cork run on latest
runners.spotlight: Won twice last year, including an early-season handicap at Cork (7f, heavy); respectable seventh of 27 in the Irish Lincoln on stable debut; little went right (hampered early, raced keenly, ran wide into straight) when he was a beaten favourite at Cork last time; capable of better.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Indepenent Expert is a light little filly but the race conditions suited her. She was in well at the weights, so it's great she's a winner at two. It was a valuable race and the owner also has an incentive to buy another horse, getting a 10,000Euros voucher to buy a yearling at an Irish sale. That's it for this year, she ran well at Gowran on testing ground, so she could have a nice mark for turf handicaps early in the season - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Cheers Again
runners.comment: Three-time AW winner has yet to score on turf, flopped when favourite at Cork 12 days ago
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner has yet to score on turf; 0-14 in this sphere and failed to run to expectations when favourite at Cork 12 days ago.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Cheers Again won't run again until the turf. I was going to go to Leopardstown in April but he won't get into that now. He's improving though and he could be a good horse - Paul Flynn, trainer.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Cheers Again came back last time and he was all wrong and I gave him a break. I honestly thought he wanted further because he was maybe a bit weak. When we brought him back, the more we did with him, the quicker he was getting - Paul Flynn, trainer.

runners.name: Instant Appeal
runners.comment: Third to City Of Troy in a maiden, missed last season, 1m2f stretched stamina on return
runners.spotlight: Third in Curragh maiden won by City Of Troy in July 2023; easy winner of a 7f Gowran maiden on only subsequent start at two; missed all last season; appeared not to stay 1m2f on his comeback at Leopardstown; shorter trip and addition of tongue-tie may help

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: I got a handy lead and Instant Appeal had a bit of experience on his side, I liked the way he picked up and he hit the line well - Scott McCullagh, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He was just too keen and fresh at Leopardstown and got tired. He could run at Limerick on Friday and we think he'll take a nice step forward from his first run. 23-04-25

runners.name: Killeaney Bear
runners.comment: Three-time winner over 1m1f, suited by good ground, big chance after pleasing hurdles run
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner over 1m1f on a sound surface; third of five behind subsequent Grade 1-winning hurdler Hello Neighbour on last Flat 2024 start at Roscommon; returned at Cork eight days ago, taking second in a 16-runner maiden hurdle; 5lb higher than for his last win but can be rated a strong contender.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Killeaney Bear didn't handle the track or the ground at Galway, but he pulled out of the race well and we chanced it. He's a big, raw horse and I would say there is more to come, especially next year - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Nakasero
runners.comment: In good form at Dundalk late last year, interesting on first run for Henry de Bromhead
runners.spotlight: Front-running winner over this trip at Killarney last summer; in good form at Dundalk late in the year, signing off for the Halford/Collins yard with a narrow win; 2lb higher, interesting on first run for Henry de Bromhead.

runners.name: Neo Smart
runners.comment: 7f winner at the Curragh last month, met trouble in running at Leopardstown last Sunday
runners.spotlight: Narrow winner of a 7f handicap on good ground at the Curragh on third outing of the season; unlucky not to finish closer over 1m2f at Leopardstown last Sunday, denied room before keeping on late.

quotes.race: View Restaurant At Dundalk Stadium Median Auction Maiden (Div II)
quotes.quote: We didn't go very fast early. Neo Smart picked up nice into the straight. The second horse headed her but to be fair she was only getting going to the line. She handled the surface well - Rory Cleary, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

2:32.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Dunum
runners.comment: Useful handicapper, unplaced in three attempts in stakes races; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper at 7f-1m1f; promoted to three-figure rating after Galway festival win in 2023; beaten 1l into third in same Galway handicap off 101 last season; unplaced in three attempts in stakes races; faded tamely in 7f Listed race at Cork on final start last season; acts on most types of ground.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Ahonoora" Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I was probably in front long enough, Dunum wasn't doing a whole lot, but, as big handicaps like that go, it was plain sailing. I could hear plenty of shouting behind me and I could tell a few might be getting boxed in, so I said I would commit and take a couple of lengths out of them. It worked. He gets a mile well, I just didn't think they went quick enough for him here on Tuesday and he was a bit keen. Even today he grabbed hold of it coming down the hill, but he had something in front of him just to keep him settled. He's a very uncomplicated horse, he just needs a good gallop in front - Billy Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets We're Here To Take Over Handicap
quotes.quote: Dunum was in good form so we decided to enter him. It's great to have a runner here let alone a winner. He had improved at home and we thought we had a bit more in hand today with the good draw - Natalia Lupini, trainer.

quotes.race: Gowran Festival Of Speed August 21st Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Dunum likes it around here and Wayne gave him a powerful ride. He likes some ease in the ground and we can aim for Galway - Natalia Lupini, trainer

runners.name: The Liffey

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Winner of two of his three starts for Aidan O'Brien, off for almost a year, stable debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Ballydoyle; winner of a 6f conditions race at the Curragh on only start at two; ran only twice at three last year; got upset in the stalls in an early-season Group 3 race at Leopardstown; much more like it when making most to win over 1m at Listowel last June; absent since; gelded and has joined Joseph O'Brien.

quotes.race: Pat Smullen Race
quotes.quote: The Liffey won nicely on his only run at two last year. I think the heavy ground at Leopardstown last month caught him out. His ideal trip is seven furlongs or a mile on quick ground and this race fitted in nicely for him. It's a nice confidence booster. He might now step back up into stakes company - Chris Armstrong, trainer's representative.

quotes.race: Oak Solutions Group Irish EBF Race
quotes.quote: The Liffey is a big horse so he will improve plenty. You could say he's a Royal Ascot horse but maybe we might take our time and come back here for the Railway Stakes - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's joined us from Ballydoyle and we're happy with how he's training. We'll make a decision about his reappearance nearer the time. 24-04-25

runners.name: Tinas Indian
runners.owner: C F Harrington & James John Hughes
runners.comment: Winning favourite on only start at three, got upset in the stalls at Tipperary on return
runners.spotlight: Winner of a 6f Curragh maiden on debut last September, justifying favouritism in beating two 73-rated rivals with plenty to spare; got upset in the stalls at Tipperary last month and failed to make a significant impact; probably capable of much better.

quotes.race: FBD Hotels And Resorts Castleknock Hotel Maiden
quotes.quote: Tina's Indian is a horse we love, we think he is very good. I've never had a horse to work like him. The owners gave him all the time he needed to develop into a horse. We were confident coming today. He is a huge horse and he has needed time - Mark Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Dance Night Andday
runners.comment: Four wins, career-best when second in a 7f Listed race at Cork last August
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner; scored narrowly in a 7f premier handicap at Leopardstown last September off 93; has run in five stakes races, by far her best effort when second in a 7f Listed race at Cork last August; fourth of seven under a big weight in a Cork handicap on reappearance.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Sovereign Path Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: When the draw came out 20 I said 'oh no', Our minds were made up that we had to drop in. The pace was strong, one of the fractions was 10 seconds. Maybe the couple of front-runners holding up earlier in the day encouraged the lads to go forward. It suited Dance Night Andday and Ronnie was unbelievable on her - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: Dance Night Andday cdame out of Naas really well. She's an improver and a very relaxed filly. She just pricked her ears and idled when she hit the front. We will probably dip our toe in Listed company now and see where we are - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer

quotes.race: Whistlin' Donkeys Playing Live After Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Dance Night Andday ran well in her maidens. She worked well during the week and we thought she would run a nice race - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer

runners.name: Elinor Dashwood
runners.comment: Has been set ambitious task in both starts this term, same again here, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Progressive last season; rated a relatively modest 75 when winning a 7f handicap at Gowran in June; ended the season on 93 based on form that featured a close fourth in a 6f Listed race at the Curragh; set ambitious task in both starts this term, same again here.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Handicap
quotes.quote: Elinor Dashwood was very free at Naas and I decided to put her asleep at the Curragh the last day. We learned a lot from her there over six furlongs with the way she came home. I said to Ronan to put her asleep again and ride her cold, which he did, and she relaxed really well and looks a million dollars. She quickened twice. She quickened to get to them and quickened to go away from them. It was a class ride. She'll get further and she might go for the big fillies' handicap at the Curragh. If not, we could look at Galway - Adrian McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Mataariki
runners.comment: Useful form at 7f/1m but probably better suited by plenty of cut in the ground
runners.spotlight: Tried in good company after debut maiden win over 1m on soft going at Gowran early last season; best run when third behind the smart Big Gossey over 7f at the Curragh in November; handled heavy ground when making all for a handicap win over 7f at Gowran last month on seasonal debut; may find this ground too quick.

runners.name: One Smack Mac
runners.comment: Soft ground and 1m not ideal for him here on seasonal debut, fair third over 6f at Cork
runners.spotlight: Rated 97; sole win from five starts on debut in a 6f maiden at this venue; second in a 6f Listed race at Fairyhouse last September; ground and 1m not ideal on his seasonal reappearance at this venue; fair third over 6f at Cork six weeks ago.

runners.name: Unique Journey
runners.owner: N W T Dalzell/James Morgan/Karl Kirwan/Mrs John Murphy
runners.comment: Promoted 13lb to 87 for course 6f win; will need another career-best to feature this time
runners.spotlight: Placed in his first three handicap starts after showing little in maidens; looked progressive in winning readily over 6f here last month on his second outing this term; promoted 13lb to 87 but will need another career-best to feature in this grade.

runners.name: Copacabana Sands
runners.comment: Fifth in 7f Group 3 at Leopardstown, met trouble and her performance can be upgraded
runners.spotlight: Showed ability for Diego Dias last season; promising second in a 7f Curragh maiden on stable/seasonal debut; built on that with encouraging fifth in 7f Group 3 at Leopardstown; met trouble in running, and her performance can be upgraded.

runners.name: Spicy Margarita
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Failed to stay 1m2f on soft last time, previously ran well over 1m at the Ciurrgah
runners.spotlight: Useful AW form; much-improved when strong-finishing fourth in 1m Group 3 Park Express Stakes at the Curragh last month; has failed to stay in two 1m2f attempts, including on latest; Dundalk win was over this trip.

3:02.race_name: Royal Ascot Trials At Naas Handicap
3:02.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Beckman
runners.comment: 6f winner, has run okay in stakes races, improve for latest, can't discount on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f Curragh maiden (good) on debut; has run creditably without winning in stakes company since; beaten 4.5l on first try at 1m in a listed race at the Curragh on seasonal comeback two weeks ago; should improve for that and not discounted on handicap debut.

quotes.race: Cunningham's Of Kildare Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Beckman is a nice horse. He has always shown us plenty despite being slow in coming. I thought he won nicely and hit the line strongly - Ger Lyons, trainer

runners.name: Va Va Vroom
runners.comment: Highly-tried after maiden win last year, steps up to 1m on h'cap debut, check market
runners.spotlight: Highly-tried to no avail last season after easily winning a 7f Leopardstown maiden (good) in July; steps up to 1m and into handicap company for the first time on her seasonal return; holds an Irish 1000 Guineas entry; the market should reveal expectations for her first run of the campaign.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Va Va Vroom ran really well at Gowran ajnd it was good to see her put it all together there. She was still a bit green but she did it well. She's in the Debutante and we will have a look at that - Jessica Harrington, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She disappointed us in France when she ran in a Group 2 at Deauville last August. They got a lot of rain the night before the race and the ground changed, so that didn't suit her - she likes to hear her hooves rattle. She finished off her season in a Listed race at Dundalk, but she got no run at all and came home strong. Her work at home is just starting to come together now and a bit of warm weather will help her. 23-04-25

runners.name: Mississippi River
runners.owner: D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Peter M Brant
runners.comment: Won a 1m maiden on penultimate, unlucky over C&D latest, up 5lb, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Has already had three runs this season; won a 1m maiden at Navan (good) on penultimate; hampered when beaten 0.75l on handicap debut on latest over this C&D (yielding) three weeks ago; raised 5lb but looks progressive and is probably the one to beat.

runners.name: Nyman
runners.comment: AW winner, shaped like 1m might suit at Cork (7f) latest, rider claims 5lb, place chance
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 0-6 on turf; shaped with promise over 7f at Cork on his seasonal reappearance last month, his first run since being gelded; is effectively 5lb lower here thanks to his rider's claim and looks worth a go at 1m on the evidence of that Cork effort; place chance.

runners.name: Sir Jeremy
runners.comment: 7f winner off 9lb lower, ground too soft last twice, needs to improve for better ground
runners.spotlight: Sole win from seven turf starts came off 67 in a 7f Down Royal nursery (good) last season and 9lb higher now; well-beaten in both starts in handicaps here at 7f-1m this season, though the ground may have been softer than ideal; could improve now back on a sounder surface but he'll need to.

runners.name: Sugar Club
runners.comment: Maiden winner last year, out of form in two runs this term, blinkers on, hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Won a Bellewstown maiden (1m, good) second time out last year; best effort in handicaps a staying on 3l fourth of 8 over 7f at the Curragh (good) last August off 77; no impact in two starts at 1m2f and 7f this season; 3lb wrong here and hard to fancy on recent showings; blinkers need to transform.

3:32.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Angelight
runners.comment: Slowly away and ran green on only start at two, could be a different proposition this term
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and ran green in  a strong maiden at Leopardstown on only start at two; could be a different proposition this term.

runners.name: Candleford Green
runners.comment: Lost out narrowly over 7f at Leopardstown on sole start at two, strong contender
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars filly lost out narrowly over 7f at Leopardstown last October on sole start at two; took a while to get the hang of things before staying on to good effect; can be fancied to uphold form with fifth-placed Lady In Paris who was having her third start; strong contender

runners.name: Drama Queen
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Well-related Wootton Bassett filly appears to the yard's second-string, hooded
runners.spotlight: Well-related Wootton Bassett filly appears to the yard's second-string, hooded.

runners.name: Ethereal Star
runners.comment: Big price when down the field at Cork on her recent debut, safe to rule out
runners.spotlight: Big price when down the field at Cork on her recent debut; safe to rule out.

runners.name: Guarded
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Frankel filly has shown nothing to suggest she can win a maiden, transformation needed
runners.spotlight: Frankel filly has shown nothing to suggest she can win a maiden; held by Candleford Green on last year's form; transformation needed.

runners.name: Hanamaya
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Can be expected to improve from Limerick debut with better ground and longer trip to suit
runners.spotlight: Can be expected to improve from debut third over 7f at Limerick, with better ground and longer trip to suit; quite possible she can turn the tables on the more exposed runner-up Indigo Dream.

runners.name: Indigo Dream
runners.comment: Relatively experienced filly, not guaranteed to uphold Limerick form with Hanamaya
runners.spotlight: Relatively experienced filly, twice runner-up last season before being given a shot at a Listed race; second again at Limerick last month; capable of a good showing but could not be guaranteed to uphold Limerick form with Hanamaya who was making her debut then.

runners.name: Lady Crossing
runners.comment: Has struggled in two outings at Gowran, can be left out of calculations
runners.spotlight: Has struggled in two outings at Gowran; can be left out of calculations.

runners.name: Lady In Paris
runners.comment: Showed a fair standard of form at two, not far behind Candleford Green at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Showed a fair standard of form at two; not far behind Candleford Green when fifth of 13 over 7f at Leopardstown on final start.

stable_tour.quote: A Blue Point filly who ran in some hot maidens as a two-year-old and we think there's plenty more to come from her at three. She's nice. 23-04-25

runners.name: Lovely
runners.comment: Handicap prospect following an improved run on seasonal debut, makes no appeal in a maiden
runners.spotlight: Handicap prospect following an improved run on seasonal debut; 67-rated filly makes no appeal in a maiden.

runners.name: Malpeque
runners.comment: Never in a challenging position at the Curragh on debut, likely to need more experience
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to the trainer's talented Snellen; never in a challenging position at the Curragh on debut, likely to need more experience.

runners.name: Shakazia
runners.breeder: H H The Aga Khan's Studs Sc
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Ran only once at two, appears held by Candleford Green and Lady In Paris
runners.spotlight: Ran only once at two, appears held by Candleford Green and Lady In Paris on Leopardstown running; now fitted with hood and tongue-tie.

runners.name: Sindria
runners.comment: Shaped quite well on only start at two but yard has a more obvious chance with Hanamaya
runners.spotlight: Shaped quite well at the Curragh on only start at two; yard has a more obvious chance with Hanamaya.

runners.name: Sound Of Lightning
runners.comment: Failed to back up a promising first run at the Curragh when down the field at Navan
runners.spotlight: Good effort at the Curragh on debut, staying on strongly to finish third; failed to back that up when down the field at Navan; down in trip after those attempts at 1m2f

4:03.race_name: Coolmore Stud Irish EBF Blackbeard Fillies Sprint Stakes (Group 3) (Fillies)
4:03.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Dawn Romance
runners.comment: Cost 160,000gns at Tattersalls Craven breeze-up sale, thrown in at the deep end
runners.spotlight: Cost 160,000gns at Tattersalls Craven breeze-up sale; second foal; half-sister to 5f/6f winner Vince L'Amour; dam 7f winner. thrown in at the deep end.

runners.name: Green Sense
runners.comment: Gave a polished display when justifying favouritism on debut in a 6f maiden at the Curragh
runners.spotlight: 90,000Euros yearling; by Starman (same sire as Lady Iman); gave a polished display when justifying favouritism on debut in a 6f maiden at the Curragh early last month, accounting for a stablemate of Signora.

quotes.race: Tote Never Beaten By SP Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Green Sense probably did more than we thought to be honest. We hoped she would run well, there's a fillies maiden in a few weeks we were set to go for after this. You would have to be impressed by her attitude, she went through the line well. Cowardofthecounty won this last year before going to Ascot, we probably should have given him another run in the meantime, so probably we'll go somewhere between now and Ascot with the filly, either the Marble Hill or the Coolmore Fillies Race at Naas- Joseph O'Brien, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

stable_tour.quote: She was very impressive on her debut at the Curragh when beating the colts - you don't see that too many times during the year with a filly. We'll probably look to go to Naas for the juvenile fillies' race next month and then have a discussion to decide the next step from there. It's always positive when the first two-year-old who runs puts in a good performance and it bodes well for the team at home. 24-04-25

runners.name: Lady Iman
runners.comment: Confirmed the potential of her debut win at Dundalk with a Listed success at the Curragh
runners.spotlight: 185,000GBP yearling; justified market confidence with impressive debut Dundalk win in March, with subsequent winner Leblon Beach back in third; confirmed significant potential with odds-on win from the Aidan O'Brien-trained 12-1 chance True Love in a 5f Listed contest at the Curragh 13 days ago; extra furlong should not present a problem, smart prospect.

quotes.race: Holden Plant Rentals First Flier Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Lady Iman is a lovely filly. Colin [Keane, rider] was very impressed with her. He said she has plenty of speed. I'm thinking of Naas [Group 3 Juvenile Fillies Sprint Stakes] next. I'll sleep on it and talk to Colin, but I've no problem with her getting six furlongs, but she has plenty of speed and will learn plenty from that. I've never taken this filly off the bridle, so I don't know her limit - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: She's a nice filly, Lady Iman was plenty green when we got there and had a good look the whole way up the straight. You would imagine she would appreciate an extra furlong, she handles a good surface and ticks a lot of boxes. She was very professional from the moment she walked into the yard - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Leblon Beach
runners.comment: AW winner, appears well held by Lady Iman based on their AW clash in March
runners.spotlight: Overcame a slow start to win a 5f maiden at Dundalk on her third start; appears well held by Lady Iman based on their AW clash in March.

runners.name: Miami Destination
runners.comment: Winning favourite on debut at the Curragh, form boosted by the runner-up Oh Cecilia
runners.spotlight: Winning favourite on debut at the Curragh; form was boosted by the runner-up Oh Cecilia in beating the odds-on favourite at Cork on her second start; stable selected

quotes.race: Shouldvebeenaring, New For 2025 At The Irish National Stud Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: We said to Wayne [Lordan, jockey] going out that Miami Destination would have no bother going six or seven furlongs , further down the road. Wayne said she needed a bit of company. She won well at the line. The ground wouldn't have been an issue for us and hopefully it's upwards and onwards now. We'll probably find a stakes race back here in May - Adrian Murray, trainer.

runners.name: Saffron Dandy
runners.comment: Apprentice-ridden when readily justifying favouritism on debut in a 5f maiden at Bath
runners.spotlight: Apprentice-ridden when readily justifying favouritism on debut in a 5f maiden at Bath 13 days ago; looked at home on fast ground; interesting for the trainer who won this race in 2015 with Great Page, two years after his father's success with the top-class Sky Lantern.

runners.name: Signora
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Sister to Exactly, a Group 3 winner for the stable in last season's Killavullan Stakes
runners.spotlight: Third foal; sister to Exactly, a Group 3 winner for the stable in last season's Killavullan Stakes and fourth in last Sunday's Pouliches; closely related to Listed winner Salt Lake City; dam Heartache won the Queen Mary and the Flying Childers for Clive Cox in 2017.

runners.name: Simply Astounding
runners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
runners.comment: Looked promising when winning over C&D on debut, was relatively easy to back, clear chance
runners.spotlight: Wootton Bassett filly is the fourth foal out of the brilliant Minding; half-sister to Group 1 juvenile winner Henry Longfellow (National Stakes); looked promising when winning over C&D on debut; was relatively easy to back as favourite, and the well-fancied runner-up had 7l to spare over the third; trainer has won this in four of the last six seasons.

4:33.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Whistlejacket
runners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith

prev_owners.owner: P M Brant & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Derrick Smith
D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Peter M Brant

runners.comment: Second to Babouche in National Stakes, workmanlike C&D winner last month, can progress
runners.spotlight: Three wins from eight starts at two, highlighted by Group 1 win in the Prix Morny; status as a top juvenile underlined by Phoenix Stakes second to today's rival Babouche, and same placing in the Middle Park; had to work hard to beat stablemate Ides Of March over C&D on seasonal debut; should be sharper now; might not the want the ground too quick but this should be fine.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Committed Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We thought both our horses were just about ready to start and wanted to hopefully get two runs into him before Ascot. The plan was to come here, go to Naas and then go for the Commonwealth Cup. Ryan [Moore] was very happy with Whistlejacket. He said he didn't get any cover and got a bit tired, but he was very happy with him. He said he didn't want to get into a barging match when he was needing the run and didn't want to blow him up at that stage, so he did the right thing and took his time - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Juddmonte Middle Park Stakes (Group 1) (Colts)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket has run a decent race but Ryan [Moore, jockey] said he thought he could have done with a stronger pace. He was a bit slow out of the gates and took a lead whereas he likes things his own way - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Sumbe Prix Morny (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket is a very fast horse. He's very quick. At the Curragh, it didn't set up perfectly for him but because he's so fast and precocious we thought he could do both races. It's hard for a horse to do both, especially when they're only a week apart, but speed is his big thing really  He's a five and six furlong horse. He's very quick so I'd say it's the Middle Park for him and then go from there with the Breeders' Cup as an aim as well - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Kingdom Of Bahrain July Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket is obviously still a bit raw and is still learning. It was a good performance - he has given away a bit of ground in the last furlong and gone a long way ahead. He is a fast horse and I think there is a bit more in there which gives us hope for the rest of the year - Ryan Moore, rider.

quotes.race: GAIN First Flier Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Whistlejacket is one we thought would win first time but we are very happy with that. He could go five or six, he has plenty of speed. He will probably got straight to Ascot - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's already a Group 1-winning sprinter, having won the Prix Morny last season. He was very consistent and is in good shape. He's a very fast horse and we think six furlongs is his trip. 07-04-25

runners.name: Babouche
runners.comment: Beat Whistlejacket in National Stakes, needs to improve on Cork run to prevail in rematch
runners.spotlight: Won her first three starts, including the Group 3 Anglesey Stakes and the Group 1 Phoenix Stakes, beating Whistlejacket on the latter occasion; winning run came to an end on soft ground behind Lake Victoria at Newmarket in the Cheveley Park; failed to cope with a 5lb penalty at Cork on return; should be close to peak fitness now.

quotes.race: Keeneland Phoenix Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Babouche is a good horse and we knew that from the start. Horses like this are hard to find. When lads like us find them, we can do it. She will stay over this trip until she tells me. For now the plan is the Cheveley Park and that will be her done for the year. There is no rush to step up in trip - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Jebel Ali Racecourse And Stables Anglesey Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Babouche has been really switched off since she won at Cork and she really has the temperament. She parked when she got to the front and hopefully she can improve. She will need to in order to keep going forward. The Phoenix Stakes is the plan - Ger Lyons, trainer.

runners.name: Bodhi Bear
runners.comment: Began the season with victory in a 5f rated race at Cork, takes a big jump in class now
runners.spotlight: 6f Navan maiden winner last October on third and final juvenile start, making all; first two starts at two were over 7f, but he started the new campaign with a win in a 5f rated race at Cork; takes a big jump in class now.

quotes.race: Buy Your Tickets Now For The Easter Festival Rated Race
quotes.quote: We'll see what the handicapper does with Bodhi Bear, there's a 3yo premier sprint handicap at Naas and another at the Curragh in June so maybe one of those. If he gets up too high in the handicap we may run him in one of those 3yo Listed races - Fozzy Stack, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: Bodhi Bear had two very good runs coming in here and he had his chance today. He stepped forward nicely in what felt like a strong maiden - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Treasure Isle
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: 5f Listed winner at two, held by Babouche on Anglesey Stakes running, second-string
runners.spotlight: 2-8 as a juvenile; won a 5f Listed event at the Curragh but limitations evident in Group 3 races; held by Babouche on Anglelsey Stakes running; missed intended seasonal debut at York this week.

quotes.race: Qatar Racing And Equestrian Club Irish EBF Juvenile Sprint Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Treasure Isle is a fast horse, we learned that last time. It's unusual for a two-year-old to put up such a fast time here. The Flying Childers is the race for him - Aidan O'Brien, trainer

quotes.race: Coolmore Stud Calyx Race
quotes.quote: Treasure Isle was still a bit green and he might improve for another run. We hope he'll be an Ascot horse and he has loads of speed - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a Listed winner over five furlongs last season. He's a very fast horse and is keen, so he might not stay that far, but we'll see. He's in good shape and nearly ready to start. 07-04-25

runners.name: Carla Ridge
runners.comment: 100-1 C&D maiden winner last autumn, creditable fourth in a 7f Group 3 race on return
runners.spotlight: Took a huge step forward from her debut when a 100-1 maiden winner over C&D last September; big task here; ran out of steam late when a creditable fourth in a 7f Group 3 race at Leopardstown on seasonal debut.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Carla Ridge is a filly we loved from the day we bought her. She was a bit disappointing at the Curragh but she did today what we hoped she might be capable of and showed that she could be a stakes filly - Patrick Harty, joint trainer.

runners.name: Temperance
runners.comment: Takes a massive jump in class following a well-deserved C&D handicap win
runners.spotlight: Deserved her recent C&D handicap win after showing promise on several occasions; takes a massive jump in class here.

quotes.race: Declan Landy Fencing Handicap
quotes.quote: I've always thought Temperance would be a black-type filly but couldn't win my maiden. I kept coming up against 90-rated horses, so I said we'd just go for a handicap. The last day I ran her back a bit too quickly and I saw it wasn't the thing to do. Everyone keeps preaching that she wants seven furlongs. I don't disagree as I think she could stay seven but I think six is her trip - Kate McGivern, trainer.

5:03.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (Watering)

runners.name: Big Gossey
runners.comment: Rated 106, won a 7f Listed on penultimate, 5f might just be on the sharp side these days
runners.spotlight: Rated 106; likeable ten-time winner, the latest coming over 7f (soft) in a Listed Curragh heat in March; goes on any ground but found things happening a bit too quickly in a Listed race over this C&D on latest when a 5l fourth of 7 behind Two Stars; hasn't won over this short a trip since 2022 and might just need a bit further these days.

quotes.race: Lester Piggott Gladness Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I thought seven furlongs might find Big Gossey out, if it was six furlongs I think he would have won easy. Billy said he was just hanging on desperately. An eight-year-old on that ground against three-year-olds, it doesn't matter how much weight they are giving away, it's very hard for young horses to take on a battle-hardened horse like him. Gary O'Brien, who leads him up, does 90 per cent of the work with him and he just occasionally gives him a pipe opener and lunges him and doesn't have to do much with him. When he arrived in the door, I never thought he'd be doing this! A Gutaifan that couldn't be sold without much of a pedigree. Apparently he might come back here! Today was his 40th start at the track - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavalor Equine Nutrition Race
quotes.quote: Big Gossey got in well at the conditions and it's a perfect sort of race for him. He is in terrific form and we might find a race for him at Dundalk before next year - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: David Power Memorial Premier Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey has been great for my career. I was delighted to see the rain as he thrives with a bit of an ease. He just loves it here. I would have loved something to bring me a bit further but I wanted to get rolling on him and not let something get first run - Robert Whearty, rider.

quotes.race: Sheehy Motors Volkswagen Race
quotes.quote: Big Gossey has been a great horse to me this season, he's a legend. He hit the line well when he won the Bold Lad, and over that ground and trip, I didn't think the seven would be a problem - Robert Whearty, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Bold Lad" Sprint Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey was a bit unlucky the last day when he missed the break. I travelled into it lovely and got a lovely run up the rail. He had a bit of a look when he got there but he stayed going - Robert Whearty, rider.

quotes.race: AK Bets "Higher Limits, Better Prices" Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey is getting better as the year goes on and he loves it up the Curragh. I'm delighted that he's after getting his head in front today. I always thought six was his ideal trip but a fast run five like that suits him down to the ground - Danny Sheehy, rider.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF "Bold Lad" Sprint Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey travelled throughout and picked up well. I was probably there a bit early but he saw it out. He has plenty of speed and did everything right - Michael Hussey, jockey.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Big Gossey came on from the last run. They went a good strong gallop which suited him and he settled lovely. When I gave him a squeeze he picked up really well. He toughed it out to the line so I'm very happy with him - Danny Sheehy, jockey.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Big Gossey is a horse that's improving every week and there's more improvement in him again. He's an out-and-out sprinter - Mick Hussey, rider

runners.name: Bucanero Fuerte
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

prev_owners.owner: AMO Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

runners.comment: 110 rated Group 1 winning 2yo, won a 6f Gr 3 here last May, ground fine, goes well fresh
runners.spotlight: 110 rated Group 1 winning 2yo returns to the track after an unsuccessful spell at stud; sole win as a 3yo came in a Group 3 here over 6f last May; came up short in top tier sprints subsequently, though not beaten that far in the Sprint Cup and Flying Five before struggling on soft at Ascot; should enjoy the ground here and has gone well fresh before; chance if retaining his ability.

quotes.race: Goffs Lacken Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Bucanero Fuerte is unbelievable and had to tough it out today. We had to come here because we'd as much done at home as we could and that run is going to bring him on plenty. He had a lot left in the tank. He did a spectacular piece of work at the Curragh last Sunday. It's on now to Ascot and we'll probably go for the Commonwealth Cup. We're really looking forward to it - Adrian Murray, trainer.

quotes.race: Keeneland Phoenix Stakes (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: I think Bucanero Fuerte is a serious horse. That's three runs and three wins here, he's the horse of a lifetime. I'd say it'll be the National Stakes for him now and I don't think he'll have any problem stepping up to 7f. He would prefer an ease in the ground but he has won on good ground. The ground today would be a bit easier than the last day. He was very impressive in his maiden here on heavy ground but it's not an issue for him as he's won on quick ground as well - Adrian Murray, trainer.

quotes.race: GAIN Railway Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I knew Bucanero Fuerte would battle because he needs every yard of 6f. He's a tough horse, really tough. He's a beautiful-looking horse too and, you know what, he's going to improve again. When he won his maiden in April he was only a shell of a horse. He is twice the horse now than he was then. Please God, we will be back here again for the Phoenix Stakes - Adrian Murray, trainer

runners.name: Ostraka
runners.comment: 101 rated mare, won a 5f Listed at Dundalk, 6f too far latest, needs a career best to win
runners.spotlight: 101 rated mare is 3-13 on turf; pulled off a shock 5f Listed win at Dundalk in October, beating Powerful Nation by a head; poor efforts both starts this season, though 6f may have stretched her last time at Cork (behind Gutsy Girl); may well do better returned to 5f on fast ground but she'll need a big career best to win in this company.

quotes.race: Rathkenny Handicap
quotes.quote: Ostraka is a grand filly and I was confident coming here. We might aim her at the Joe McGrath Handicap in the autumn - Danny Murphy, trainer.

quotes.race: Extra Place Races At Novibet Irish EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Ostraka is a very laid back filly and had been working well at home but ours generally take a run, but the better ones don't so she's probably in that bracket - Michael Halford, joint-trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Magnum Force
runners.comment: Breeders' Cup Juvenile winner, rated 112, well-treated by race conditions, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: 112 rated 3yo Mehmas colt progressed well as a 2yo, culminating with a win in the Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf at Del Mar (5f, firm); well-treated by the race conditions on his return, fast ground is ideal and while this is likely a stepping stone towards bigger targets later in the season, he is the one they have to beat.

quotes.race: Breeders' Cup Juvenile Turf Sprint (Grade 1) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm speechless, I knew Magnum Force was the right horse for the job, whether he was good enough we didn't know. But when you've Colin Keane riding for you - probably the most underrated champion jockey in the world - you've got a great chance - Ger Lyons, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: To be honest Magnum Force probably bumped into one the first day. He's a horse who always shows us a lot of natural speed, a very straightforward horse at home, and we were a little bit shocked he got beat but, saying that, Gary [Carroll, jockey] liked the colt who beat him so you'd expect he'd do that today. The fast surface and the fitting of a tongue-tie probably helped - Colin Keane, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Gutsy Girl
runners.comment: 90 rated filly, decent fourth in a Listed on penultimate, may be able to nick black type
runners.spotlight: 90 rated filly won twice for Charlie Fellowes, a 6f Carlisle maiden (gd-fm) and a 6f Kempton handicap off 83; ran creditably on debut for this yard when a 2.5l fourth of 8 in a Listed race at Cork (6f, good, Ostraka well behind); beaten off 90 in a 5f Curragh handicap latest; hard to see her winning this but could stay on and nick some black type if they go off too quickly in front.

runners.name: Powerful Nation
runners.comment: 103 rated 3yo, narrowly beaten by Ostraka in Dundalk, returns with yard in form, go well
runners.spotlight: 103 rated 3yo Sioux Nation colt narrowly denied over 5f at Dundalk the last twice; beaten 0.5l in a Listed race in early October and a head by Ostraka in a Group 3 there later that month when not getting a clear run; also has placed Listed form at 5f on good to firm; gets weight from most of his rivals and returns with his yard in fine form; should go well.

runners.name: Saratoga Special
runners.comment: 87 rated 3yo filly, struggled in a Listed race latest, tongue tie goes on, needs more
runners.spotlight: 87 rated 3yo filly; Listed placed at two at the Curragh (5f, good); off the mark in a 5f Cork maiden (good) on seasonal reappearance; raced a bit keenly and finished well beaten in a Cork Listed race on latest (5.5f, good); gets weight from all her rivals but needs more to get involved at the finish in this company; wears a first-time tongue tie.

3:05.race_name: Le Defi des Haras - Grand Steeple-Chase de Paris (Chase) (Grade 1) (5yo+) (Turf)

runners.name: In Love
runners.owner: Andrew Peake, Simon Macauley & Bryant Family

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Magalen O Bryant & Mlle Muriel Caslant

runners.name: Jazz Manouche
runners.breeder: J-L Berger, C Gallorini Berger & Mlle A Berger

runners.name: Le Roi David
runners.owner: David Dahan, Salomon Taieb & M Seror

runners.name: Toscana Du Berlais
runners.owner: Ecurie Hub De Montmirail, Haras Du Berlais & Scea Equi Flore

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Hub De Montmirail, Haras Du Berlais & Scea Equi Flore
Ecurie Hub De Montmirail, Haras Du Berlais & Scea Equi Flore

runners.name: Gran Diose
runners.owner: F & O Hinderze Racing & Luc Monnet

quotes.race: Grand Steeple-Chase de Paris (Chase) (Grade 1) (5yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We planned to sit behind the leaders and I was a bit worried when we lost Juntos Ganamos, as Gran Diose can lose confidence at his obstacles if he's out on his own for two long. But Clement filled him up with confidence in letting Grandeur Nature come alongside. Today has been the sole objective and a lot of commentators and journalists said he wasn't the same horse as last year, but my jockey listened to me when I told him that everything was leading up to May 19 and not one day before - Louisa Carberry, trainer.

runners.name: Grandeur Nature
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint-Voir & Mme B-M Goin

runners.name: Goliath Du Rheu
runners.owner: Jacques Detre, Patrice Detre & Ecurie Team Spirit

runners.name: Inaya Jones
runners.breeder: Earl De Cordelles & Earl La Dariole

prev_owners.owner: S Ruel, N Dubief & C Dubourg

runners.name: Kolokico
runners.owner: Lord Daresbury, Ecurie Mme Jacques Cypres & Nicolas Cypres

quotes.race: Prix Ferdinand Dufaure (Chase) (Grade 1) (4yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I think we'll keep Kolokico but there might be a bit of a conversation as to whether he goes to England to join Oliver[Greenall], or else stays here. But that's the only decision to make, he won't be sold. What's lovely about Emmanuel is that's not his way. He's just very calm and he told me he liked the horse but that he was very weak, and this was a big step up. I rather like that way of thinking - Lord Daresbury, part owner.

runners.name: Le Rivage
runners.owner: Ecurie Le Rivage, Francois Nicolle & Jean-Michel Baudouin

runners.name: Lecoeurdeshommes
runners.breeder: P Thiriet, M Larobe Et Al
runners.owner: Jacques Detre, Patrice Detre & Ecurie Team Spirit

runners.name: Legolas Tek
runners.breeder: T Krau, P Lhuillier & F Badaut

runners.name: Botervia Du Kalon
runners.breeder: Mme M De Kerpezdron & E De Kerpezdron

4:30.race_name: Prix Alain du Breil - Course de Haies de Printemps des 4yo (Hurdle) (Grade 1) (Turf)

runners.name: Six Figures
runners.owner: Ecurie Thomas Sivadier, Y Fouin Et Al

runners.name: World Apart
runners.owner: Alain Jathiere, Jean-Pierre-Joseph Dubois Et Al

runners.name: Nikkaluokta
runners.breeder: Mme L-U Delaunay & E Palluat De Besset
runners.owner: Gerald Laroche, Ecurie Bertrand Milliere Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Bertrand Milliere, Cedric Milliere & J-P Gauvin

runners.name: Leho
runners.breeder: Suc A Elias De Proenca, J Elias De Proenca Et Al

runners.name: Neverchangedoctor
runners.breeder: T Storme & Thierry Lohest Racing & Breeding
runners.owner: Thierry Storme & Thierry Lohest Racing & Breeding

prev_owners.owner: Sacha Tubiana, Chauvigny Global Equine Sasu Et Al

runners.name: Lemon Sweet
runners.breeder: Mme D Saliou, Haras De La Haie Neuve & Mme E Saliou

runners.name: Diamond Du Berlais
runners.breeder: Haras Du Berlais & Ballantines Racing Stud Ltd

runners.name: Goal Oriented
runners.breeder: Runnymede Farm Llc & Cwc Investment 2 Llc
runners.owner: Sf Racing Llc, Starlight Racing Et Al
runners.comment: Having his first crack at a big race and holds leading claims.
runners.spotlight: Landed a narrow success in an allowance optional claimer at Churchill Downs (sloppy track) two weeks ago upped to 1m 1/2 f; on a hat-trick after last win and nicely bred (by Not This Time); stable is ticking along nicely; should have every chance on first attempt at a big race.

runners.name: Journalism
runners.owner: Bridlewood Farm, Don Alberto Stable Et Al
runners.comment: Should not be far away; second in the Kentucky Derby 14 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Won a Grade 2 in December and took the Santa Anita Derby 42 days ago; ahead of Sandman and American Promise when runner-up (beaten 1 1/2 l, sloppy track) in the Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs two weeks ago; he's an attractive contender.

quotes.race: Kentucky Derby presented by Woodford Reserve (Grade 1) (3yo) (Main Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: I had a beautiful trip. I had the trip I wanted and saved ground into the first turn. On the backside, I had a lot of horses in front of me that didn't appear to have a chance. So, I knew I had enough horse still and waited for the right time. Past the half-mile pole Journalism started running for me. I was smoothly getting him into a rhythm. I wanted to turn for home with just a couple of horses ahead of me. That's what happened but Sovereignty was the best today - Umberto Rispoli, jockey.Journalism broke well. But at the eighth pole the first time by he got shuffled by a horse just to our outside over toward the rail. But Umberto [Rispoli] got him in the clear and he was in a good spot all the way through the backside. He made a nice middle move, then on the turn for home he opened up but I saw the blue silks coming at us and I knew that was the one we were going to have to be concerned about. He ran on the best he could and he ran a very good race. But the winner ran a better race - Michael McCarthy, trainer.

runners.name: American Promise
runners.comment: This is competitive and unlikely to do better than a supporting role.
runners.spotlight: Problems at the start (bumped, Churchill Downs, sloppy track) behind two of these when tailed off in the Kentucky Derby 14 days ago; won a Grade 3 in March; has chalked up two wins from his last five; passed over with a number of his rivals in good nick.

runners.name: Heart Of Honor
runners.comment: Nose second in Group 2 UAE Derby on the Dirt at Meyden;  place claims.
runners.spotlight: Has in fantatsic form on the Dirt in UAE this winter winning two conditions races over 1m before finishing second three times in Listed and Pattern company most recently when a nose second to Admire Daytona in the Group 2 UAE Derby (1m1f110y) picking up plenty of prize-money in the process; interesting to see where that form stands in this field but unlike many GB raiders is proven on Dirt.

quotes.race: UAE Derby Sponsored By Jumeirah (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Heart Of Honor has put up a lifetime best and you always have to be pleased when that happens. But this is a tough one to swallow - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

quotes.race: UAE 2000 Guineas Presented By Longines (Group 3) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It had a mile and a quarter written all over it. There was a lot of traffic and Heart Of Honor doesn't have the gate speed of some of the others. Clearly, he's long in stamina. We've got four weeks until the Al Bastakiya and that's where we'll go. The extra couple of furlongs looks like being the key - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Maritime City (DMC) (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Heart Of Honor had a few quicker horses around him this time and they came across him and he got a bit of kickback. He didn't learn much last time as we were three or four wide and he didn't face any kickback. He still had a good old look when he hit the front, so I think there's a bit more in the tank. We mustn't forget that he was giving away 5lb too, probably to a good horse, so it was a tough performance - Adrie de Vries, jockey.

quotes.race: Arabian Radio Network (Conditions) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Jim and Claire came here last year with Many A Star, who wasn't good enough, and this year we wanted to do things differently so thankfully they backed me in buying dirt horses. It was also my brief to give Claire a winner two days before her birthday, and it's not often a plan comes off! - Jamie Osborne, trainer.

runners.name: Pay Billy
runners.comment: Having his first crack at a big race and can't be considered.
runners.spotlight: Going for a hat-trick; narrow success in a stakes (Laurel Park) four weeks ago; couldn't be confident about him on first attempt at a big race.

runners.name: River Thames
runners.owner: Winstar Farm Llc, Chc Inc Et Al
runners.comment: Likely to be in contention; not beaten far five weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Third but only beaten less than a length five weeks ago (Keeneland) in a Grade 1; has made an impressive start to his career with two wins from four starts; has to be respected.

runners.name: Sandman
runners.owner: Dj Stable Llc, St Elias Stable Et Al
runners.comment: Should not be far away; successful three times in his last seven starts.
runners.spotlight: Managed three wins in his last seven outings; well held in the Kentucky Derby (Churchill Downs, sloppy track) 14 days ago; is a player.

quotes.race: Kentucky Derby presented by Woodford Reserve (Grade 1) (3yo) (Main Track) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: Sandman was traveling well despite being the first time on the sloppy track. I felt like on the backside I was following the right horses and I saw Junior (Alvarado on Sovereignty) and Journalism in front of me. I wish I was more patient and sat there a little longer and cut the corner. He was very steady, gave me a good effort but disappointed with the result - Jose Ortiz, jockey.

runners.name: Clever Again
runners.owner: Winchell Thoroughbreds Llc, Mrs John Magnier Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier, Michael B Tabor Et Al

runners.comment: Ought to be competitive; has won two of his three career runs.
runners.spotlight: Has won two of his three career runs; got the job done by 4l at Oaklawn Park over 1m (stakes) 48 days ago; has to be considered.

runners.name: Gosger
runners.breeder: Harvey A Clarke Racing Stable LLC
runners.owner: Harvey A Clarke Racing Stables Llc
runners.comment: Despite that Keeneland success, may have to settle for supporting role at best.
runners.spotlight: Winner of two of his three runs to date and related to Grade 1 winner Harvey's Lil Goil; last seen landing the Lexington Stakes (Keeneland) last month; despite that Keeneland success, not hard to turn elsewhere.

3:33.race_name: Coolmore City of Troy German 2000 Guineas (Group 2) (3yo Colts & Fillies) (Turf)

runners.name: Ciaran
runners.breeder: Haras De Grandcamp Earl & Ecurie Vivaldi

runners.name: Lips Vega
runners.breeder: Lope De Vega Syndicate & Stall Parthenaue

quotes.race: Qatar Prix Marcel Boussac - Criterium des Pouliches (Group 1) (2yo Fillies) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: It's always hard when you have two runners for different owners and they have both run brilliantly. I felt a lot of pressure in the build-up with Zarigana. She had a tough trip and it's hard to come down the middle of the track at Longchamp with a big crowd. Vertical Blue had a dream run around the inside and is a filly with more experience and who is progressing with every race. I'm delighted for Francis Teboul and his family - Francis Graffard, trainer.

7:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

5:45.race_name: Sky Bet Proud To Support RoR Handicap

runners.name: Northern Ticker
runners.comment: Progressive over 6f in the north last term; good third in Two Year Old Trophy final start
runners.spotlight: Progressive over 6f in the north last year, winning twice; good third when favourite for the Two Year Old Trophy in final outing; hit with a 14lb rise in his mark for that effort but could have more to offer.

quotes.race: Premier Electrical EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Northern Ticker won on the all-weather and that race has worked out well. I could have just done with a lead probably a little bit longer but at least he's had a bit of a race and learned a bit today. All his work at home's been very good. He's one of the best horses I've ridden for a long time. He's still a big baby as well and a winter on his back will do him the world of good - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: I've always liked him. He ran well in his first race at Carlisle behind Line Of Force. I didn't want to run him on firm ground, which is why he then went on the all-weather at Newcastle. He won very well by five lengths and we're looking at Carlisle on Thursday to give him more experience. Then, possibly if the ground is all right and he gets on okay there, the plan would be the Redcar Two-Year-Old Trophy on October 5. He looks pretty useful. 28-08-24

runners.name: Columnist
runners.comment: Best 2yo effort when third in the Coventry; ran to nowhere near his mark on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Campaigned at Group level last term after debut win, best effort when third in the Coventry; ran to nowhere near his mark in Ascot handicap (7f) on reappearance but may fare better with the outing under his belt.

runners.name: Bolo Neighs
runners.comment: Off the mark in Curragh sales race then ran creditably in Listed grade; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Showed useful form over 6f in last two starts as a 2yo, opening his account with easy success in Curragh sales race then creditable third in York Listed event; may improve further this term and is one to consider.

quotes.race: Goffs 500
quotes.quote: Bolo Neighs pricked his ears once he got to the rails. I only had to give him one flick and push him out. He quickened up well and I liked him - Chris Hayes, rider.

stable_tour.quote: An honest and hardy type, it was a great touch winning the sales race at the Curragh. He'll be campaigned over five and six furlongs and he's got a bit of size about him, so I'd be hopeful he's trained on. 28-04-25

runners.name: Dark Cloud Rising
runners.comment: Made all at Pontefract on reappearance; respectable fourth over C&D since; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Gelded after final 2yo start; fairly useful form in 6f handicaps this term, making all at Pontefract then respectable fourth at Newmarket; ties in with American Style on the latter effort; solid chance.

stable_tour.quote: We liked him a lot last year and he looked good when winning on his return last week. We gelded him and it's probably been the making of him. He's a big, scopey horse and physically he's improved again. He likes top of the ground and there are plenty of races for him at Newmarket, including a three-year-old six-furlong race on Guineas weekend. 14-04-25

runners.name: Good Banter
runners.comment: Mixed results on AW since handicapping; needs to show progress back on turf
runners.spotlight: Went close in turf contest on debut; campaigned on AW since, winning twice at novice level but producing mixed results in handicaps; chance depends on whether the return to this sphere prompts progress.

runners.name: Aurora Majesty
runners.comment: May show progress back down in class, with this drop to 6f worth exploring; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Unraced at two; campaigned over 7f this spring, winning twice on AW then coming up well short in the Greenham; may be capable of progress back down in class, with this trip worth exploring (closely related to a 6f scorer); shortlisted.

runners.name: Sixtygeesbaby
runners.comment: Form figures of 411 in novice events; interesting with further improvement plausible
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 411 in 6f novice events, the wins at Newmarket (impressively) and Doncaster (narrowly), both under Neil Callan; now ridden by that jockey's son Jack, who takes off a handy 7lb; interesting with further improvement plausible.

stable_tour.quote: He's a half-brother to Rogue Lightning. He won a novice under a penalty at Doncaster last month and that form looks strong. He might go to Newmarket next for a valuable handicap a week on Saturday. He's got a wonderful attitude and was very resolute at Doncaster - he really put his head down and battled, which is a trait you love to see. He was very laid-back last year and green and backward at Windsor when he made his debut, but the penny has really dropped now. He's done a bit of work with Invictus Gold and I hope he can be a nice flagbearer for the yard throughout the year. 14-05-25

runners.name: Marchogion
runners.comment: Has reached a fairly useful standard on AW; turf promise has substance; could go well
runners.spotlight: Turf promise last August has substance; subsequent AW form (mostly over 6f) features a novice win and two fairly useful handicap efforts, latest at Newcastle on Good Friday; looks capable of being involved.

runners.name: American Style
runners.comment: Made all at Ripon on reappearance; creditable second over C&D since; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery prior to reappearance win at Ripon where he made all; creditable second over C&D since, having raced close to the pace set by Dark Moon Rising; both hold solid claims in the rematch.

5:15.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Roberto Escobarr
runners.comment: Dropped another 4lb, which makes it 17lb below his peak mark; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Dual Group 3 winner (2m/1m7f) for other yards in 2023; he didn't beat many last February-October and 1m4f for last month's reappearance (40-1) was too short; the latter was probably his most encouraging of five runs for current yard, however, and he's been dropped another 4lb since, which makes it 17lb below his peak mark; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto Henry II Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Roberto Escobarr was off for a lot of last year. We brought him back this year hoping he would qualify for All-Weather Finals Day but he was just a little bit rusty in that race and he finished third. We have just been waiting for this quicker ground. He wants good, good to firm ground and he is slightly unexposed over the two miles. It is lovely for him to win his Group race. His brother Pablo Escobarr won his Group race as well. We are delighted. He is as genuine as anything and Richard (Kingscote) said he was relaxed in front and was very comfortable travelling around there and he has stuck his head down and fought to the line which is fantastic. We hadn't really discussed any further than today. We are slightly ground dependent. We will get him out of this and I will have a chat with William (Haggas, trainer) and Mr Lootah and we will make a plan - Richard Knight, representing the winning owner Hussain Alabbas Lootah.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Race To The Ebor Grand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Roberto Escobarr did well. It was hard for him as he's still very raw and they were all spread out. He didn't really have anything to race with, but he stays well and just does enough. He's going the right way, he didn't like the ground last time at Ascot, he likes fast ground. I hope he'll go on improving as he's still quite a baby - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: williamhill.com Best Odds Guaranteed Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Roberto Escobarr is a grand horse. He has a good temperament and he'll stay well - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

runners.name: Assail
runners.comment: Never dangerous at Meydan in February; can hopefully bounce back; plenty of hope for 1m6f
runners.spotlight: Only seven races in total but progressive in 2023 and 2024, including winning well at Ascot (1m4f, good to firm) last July; off for five months before never dangerous at Meydan this February on his only other start on turf; can hopefully bounce back from that and there is plenty of hope for 1m6f.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice, progressive horse. He probably won quite a weak race last time out for an Ascot handicap. It doesn't look strong form but he got a 7lb rise, probably correctly, because he won very comfortably. I think he'll stay very well. A mile and a half is the bare minimum for him and he'll get 1m6f and 2m in time - what he's doing at this trip is almost a bonus. He's got a family full of stamina even though he's by No Nay Never. He's straightforward and a horse we like. I'd like to think we can get more out of him. 04-09-24

runners.name: Liari
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Son Altesse L'Aga Khan
runners.comment: 1-3 on French Flat; fairly useful hurdler, consistent last jumps season, albeit in defeat
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful hurdler who was consistent last jumps season, albeit in defeat; has left Paul Nicholls (same owners); unexposed on Flat (1-3 in France early in 2023) and needs a second look.

quotes.race: Boylesports Daily Money Back 2nd Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Liari is a gorgeous horse. He came from France where he did okay on the Flat. He's improved since his last run and will keep improving. He'll have an entry in the Triumph, but there are plenty of other races in the spring - back here might suit him. He's a lovely horse for the future and needs looking after - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: There were some who were disappointed by his first run back at Chepstow, but I'm not one of them. He's a lean individual who you don't want to over-work at home, so I knew he'd need his reappearance but he ran well off top weight. I've always planned to go for the Greatwood Hurdle, so that first outing should bring him on considerably. He lost his unbeaten record last season in the Fred Winter when very unlucky, as a swinging hurdle caught him three out, and he was fortunate not to injure himself. There's a lot more to come from him. 04-11-24

runners.name: Campaign Trail
runners.comment: Progressive stayer in 2023; missed a year and it hasn't been smooth sailing over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Unraced on firmer than good; progressive stayer on the Flat in 2023 before being sold for 200,000gns; missed a year afterwards and it hasn't been smooth sailing since his hurdle debut win last November, for instance close up in first-time cheekpieces in April (2m3f) but well held in them 12 days ago; no cheekpieces on this return to Flat.

quotes.race: Watch Unbridled On attheraces.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We bought Campaign Trail at the sales last year and he had a hairline fracture on his pelvis literally the first day we schooled him, so we gave him the whole year off. Willie Mullins said to me at the time if he was his, then he'd be out in the field, although he did actually end up that way because we couldn't train him. They've [Its Only Money ownership group] been incredibly patient. It's a big investment and they've got something to look forward to - Kim Bailey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's an exciting young horse who had a good record on the Flat. He's ready to run over hurdles after a setback last year. He's done everything we've asked of him and I'm really looking forward to seeing him out. 19-11-24

runners.name: Artisan Dancer
runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: Not crying out for drop back to 1m6f but highly respected as an in-form candidate
runners.spotlight: Went close on return (2m, AW), off the mark on turf at Ripon (2m, good) in April and ran creditably at Chester (2m2f) nine days ago; not crying out for drop back to 1m6f but highly respected as an in-form candidate.

runners.name: Sportingsilvermine
runners.comment: Revelation for new yard at about 1m3f/1m4f, keeping on well; probably well handicapped
runners.spotlight: 0-18 in Ireland (close second on good to firm) but won at Southwell and Musselburgh on his first two starts for James Owen before going close under a 7lb claimer at Chester; those big runs for new yard have been over about 1m3f/1m4f, keeping on well, with last two starts on good ground, and he's probably well handicapped on this first crack at 1m6f.

6:15.race_name: Sky Bet For The Fans Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Bopedro
runners.comment: 9yo who ran on into second of 13 for a quite valuable race here (1m1f) 15 days ago
runners.spotlight: Both British wins were at Newmarket in 2023; still capable of useful form and ran on into second of 13 for a quite valuable race here (1m1f) 15 days ago; sole attempt over this far was in 2019 but he looks worth another go.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Handicap
quotes.quote: Ours were needing the run and the Lincoln run might have just put Bopedro right. Lee Bond (owner) told me to leave the visor off as it might just freshen him up so I have to give him the credit for it. He had good form for Jessie Harrington and there is a good programme for these milers - David O'Meara, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: We had Bopedro at the end of last year and had a good run at Leopardstown. He won well for Mr Bolger here in the past so we were hoping the track would bring about some improvement in him. He's a bit of a boyo and is a good lead horse at home, he's been leading Lucky Vega for the last while - Shane Foley, rider

quotes.race: Barry's Tea Supporting Marymount Hospice Handicap
quotes.quote: Myself and Kevin were just saying beforehand that we couldn't believe the horse was 40-1. He has good form in France and was winning around Fontainebleau and running well at Vichy for his previous connections. They're no backwards tracks, just a drop down from Parisian courses. We haven't had the horse for long and took a chance with him. Kevin said he handled the track and ground well, I'd say slower ground would be no problem to him either. He's a lovely-looking horse who is great to deal with, uncomplicated, and it's nice to get our first winner for Mr Zhang and Yulong, having hit the crossbar with one or two before. We have about a half dozen for him - Ger Flynn, representative for Jim Bolger, trainer of Bopedro

stable_tour.quote: He could go for the mile handicap at Newmarket on Thursday as he likes the track there. He's done a good bit of work and has been in good form, so we're looking forward to starting him back. 14-04-25

runners.name: Mutaawid
runners.comment: Absent since August (gelded) when fifth at Goodwood, hanging; blinkers are reinstated
runners.spotlight: 6l novice win at Kempton (1m4f, AW) last July with first-time blinkers; has come up shy in handicaps on all three starts since, absent since August (gelded) when fifth of 11 at Goodwood 15 days ago; kept hanging in the closing stages that day and the blinkers are reinstated; unraced on firmer than good; this is a small field but others are still a bit more persuasive.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission/British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mutaawid is beautifully bred but it's taken a while for the penny to drop, with the blinkers clearly having been a big help here. I like him, I think he's a smart horse and liked the surface -  Jim Crowley, winning jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Terwada
runners.comment: Penultimate start was clearly best result last term; left Ed Walker for 50,000gns October
runners.spotlight: First win (2023) was on good to firm; close call at Yarmouth (1m2f, good to soft) last August was a reminder of his early promise but clearly his best result last term; left Ed Walker for 50,000gns in October and his trainer took a big prize last weekend with a newcomer to the stable.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Terwada has taken a while to learn, he's a big boy and we've been patient. He was much more switched on today and Oisin (Murphy, jockey) said he did it smoothly. He might be better with a bit more juice and we'll see what the handicapper does - George Baker, representing trainer Ed Walker, speaking to RacingTV.

stable_tour.quote: He never showed any spark at Newbury last Saturday, which was a very disappointing start. With the rest of the string running so well, it was a bit of a head-scratcher. We might put some headgear on as he's run three bad races on the bounce, which is a little concerning. 25-04-24

runners.name: Mr Baloo
runners.comment: Close, front-running 3rd at Lingfield (sole go at 1m2f); good third of 14 here (1m, good)
runners.spotlight: Four wins on AW this year (7f-9.4f); close, front-running third at Lingfield (sole attempt at 1m2f, AW) last month and good third of 14 here (1m, good) 15 days ago; 3lb claimer gives way to 7lb claimer; considered.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a revelation through the winter and I was really proud of the way he fought back when two horses went by him at Lingfield on Friday. He's won eight races now and he's not finished yet. 22-04-25

runners.name: Andaleep
runners.comment: 9yo, latest win last July; highly competitive mark if races this spring have put him right
runners.spotlight: Fifth in last year's Cambridgeshire here; 12 wins in all, the latest at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) last July off 3lb lower; it's a highly competitive mark if the two runs this spring have put him right.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca-Fenwa Handicap
quotes.quote: Andaleep was a pleasure to ride. The idea was to sit handy and tough it out, and he was a very game performer - Callum Hutchinson, jockey.

quotes.race: Imber Court Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought a mile and a half would be his trip but I was wrong! Andaleep likes proper quick ground and a mile and a quarter suits him really well. We'll look for another similar race on a stiff track - Graeme McPherson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: When he was sent to us, we thought he'd win a couple because he was well handicapped, but not eight! He just keeps finding more, but this winter I think we've learned more too. Before, he was bullying lesser horses, but he's now at a level where we've had to work out exactly how to ride him, while there's a style of race that suits. He likes to come through horses, but seems suited to 1m2f and 1m4f races, where they don't go hard and it's a sprint. I think that's why he did well on the all-weather over the winter because they seem to walk in plenty of those races. He's won of turf, though, and should be out again in May. 02-05-24

runners.name: Primo Lara
runners.comment: Won last May in his first two handicaps but no impact in his only two starts afterwards
runners.spotlight: Unraced on firmer than good; won last May in his first two handicaps, latterly over 1m2f at York (good to soft) off 8lb lower than today; 11th of 17 and last of eight in his only two runs since, last autumn, and he was 11-10 favourite on second occasion; bit to prove after that but still lightly raced.

runners.name: My Margie

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late R A Gander
