runners.comment: Started 2025 well (AW) as she did last year; more to prove upped in trip and back on turf
runners.spotlight: Won three AW handicaps last year (her first two starts and her final one) and another at Southwell three weeks ago, following her second wind operation; edging up the weights, with more to prove moving up in trip and back on turf, but she's not at all discounted.

runners.name: Lordsbridge Blu
runners.comment: Having his first turf run since a promising debut; player if back to his autumn AW form
runners.spotlight: Landed a Wolverhampton novice (9.4f) last September and better form taking minor honours in 1m2f/1m4f handicaps in the autumn, all on the AW; weakened out of it on both starts this season and this is his first turf run since a promising debut; player on his autumn form; lightly raced and his yard is among the winners.

runners.name: Lord Rapscallion
runners.comment: In-form 9yo whose last-time win brought up an AW hat-trick; landed this race in 2023
runners.spotlight: Retains plenty of gusto aged nine and scored in big field at Chelmsford most recently, completing an AW hat-trick; successful (off just 1lb lower) in this race two years ago; likely player.

quotes.race: bet365 Bunbury Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I wanted to get out in a prominent position and I found myself with an easy lead. Once Lord Rapscallion has hit the rising ground he has run on again. He has definitely got a big day in him - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: Lord Rapscallion never got going at Galway. He is a horse with a lot of ability and a late maturing horse. He is bringing his home work now to the track and it's unbelievable the way Nikita has clicked with him - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Race & Stay Apprentice Rated Race
quotes.quote: Lord Rapscallion has improved since we put the eyeshields on him. I thought it was going to be a tougher test for him today but he has clicked into gear and the surface suits him well. We might take a chance on a bigger one later in the season - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Luke and Nellie Comer Memorial Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Lord Rapscallion has been a bit of a baby but the step up in trip suited him here. Denis said he travelled very well in the race. We'll probably keep him on the go for now - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's a very talented horse who joined us in the autumn having been with Johnny Murtagh. He was given a few runs over the winter on the all-weather, where he didn't show much and his handicap mark dropped 10lb. During the spring he finished runner-up at Newmarket and Goodwood behind two nice sorts. He ran in the Buckingham Palace Stakes last week at Royal Ascot and all things considered we were very pleased with his fourth place. He got out well but then was hampered 5f out and after being hit on the nose by a whip 2f out he ran on well. That was very encouraging and now we'll aim to run him in the Bunbury Cup if he gets in. He's clearly a smart handicapper and I think he'll continue to give us a lot of fun. 23-06-21

runners.name: Mercury Day
runners.comment: Successful (off just 1lb lower) on the other course here last June; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Both wins over 1m last June, including handicap (off just 1lb lower) on the other course here; no further progress since but is competitively weighted and can't be ruled out; has form at 7f.

quotes.race: Durcan Bloodstock Pat Smullen Memorial Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We were gutted Mercury Day was balloted out of the Sandringham Handicap at Royal Ascot as we've always liked her and she's from a good Juddmonte family. She's in a mile and a quarter handicap at the July Festival but Jim said to stick at a mile for now - Conrad Allen, trainer.

runners.name: Waiting All Night
runners.comment: Ran respectably in first-time visor here two weeks ago; 4lb below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably in first-time visor here (1m) two weeks ago, while shaping as if this return to 7f will suit; scored twice, including off 4lb higher, on the July course here last term; possibilities.

quotes.race: Racing Welfare Supporting Mental Health Awareness Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Band D)
quotes.quote: We've worked back from Royal Ascot with Waiting All Night and he could run again before then. He's not just a five-furlong horse and we have a few more of Rajasinghe's progeny and other two-year-olds to run in the next few weeks, so we'll hopefully have a strong team for the meeting. It's hard to win from such a wide draw here, particularly on debut, so he's done very well and it shows the ability he has and attitude to go with it - Richard Spencer, trainer.

runners.name: Lyndon B
runners.owner: P Duffy, D Semmens, V Williams, R Harper, M Loveday

prev_owners.owner: W J and T C O Gredley

runners.comment: Lacks recent match practice and hasn't won since 2022
runners.spotlight: Remains perfectly well handicapped on best form; however, this 9yo lacks recent match practice (absent for seven months) and hasn't won since 2022; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Mudamer
runners.comment: Only 1-15 for current yard but ran encouragingly (close third) at Ripon on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Only 1-15 for current stable, the win at Beverley (7.5f) in 2023; however, ran encouragingly (close third over 1m) at Ripon on reappearance and remains on a workable mark; in the mix.

quotes.race: Jill Willows Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Mudamer would have won before now - he's very talented. I think the cheekpieces have helped him a lot because he hit the front at York and then just shut down. It's just made him focus. He's made hard work of it on what he does at home. I have a horse, Scottish Summit, rated 91 and this fella will kick him into touch without even coming off the bridle - Geoff Harker, trainer.

runners.name: Yaaser
runners.owner: Michele Craig And David D Smith
runners.comment: Won going away at Ayr three weeks ago; made good late headway at York on Friday
runners.spotlight: Record is 8-51; won going away at Ayr three weeks ago; made good late headway from rear in big field at York (again over 7f) on Friday, showing that he remains in form; difficult to rule out.

quotes.race: Musselburgh Windsor FC Celebrating 70 Years Handicap
quotes.quote: The race didn't set up the way we thought as Joe (Fanning) got to the front and slowed up a bit but Yaaser did it well, he ran as straight as a gun-barrel up the straight. The last time here we probably played too early and we've learnt from that, the more you take him back the more he comes back on the bit. I think you could even play him later as he has a good turn of foot - Jim Goldie, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He looks to be back to his best and his best is very good. He had a good year last year but not quite where we'd had him before. He looked really well in the paddock before he won and showed his wellbeing in the race. He's won some nice races. He likes a strong pace to run at over 7f and I think that's possibly his optimum, but he ran well in the Carlisle Bell over a stiff mile. We've won it before but that race is on our bucket list, but it may be a bit sharp for him at the moment. We'll have a look at York for him because he ran well there last year and a big field over 7f would suit him. 07-05-25

runners.name: Ash Wednesday
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D R Guest & Mr & Mrs Jpm Main
runners.comment: Record of 6-7 on AW this year; respected assuming the progress is transferred back to turf
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on turf; tremendously productive on AW this year, winning six of his seven races (6f trip provides an excuse for the defeat); respected, assuming he transfers the progress back to this sphere.

runners.name: Lunario
runners.owner: Michael Watt, Roy David, Christmas Party

prev_owners.owner: Christmas Party, M Watt & R David

runners.comment: His two efforts for new stable suggest this belated drop back to 7f is worth exploring
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly at 1m but his two efforts this season, for new stable, suggest this belated return to 7f is worth exploring; only 1lb above last winning mark; one to consider.

runners.name: Kit Gabriel
runners.comment: Close second, clear of remainder, at Leicester last weekend for a solid return to turf
runners.spotlight: AW winner for current yard; close second, clear of remainder, at Leicester (1m) last weekend for a solid return to turf; defied a 2lb higher mark in this sphere (6f) in 2021; fighting chance.

runners.name: Flag Of St George
runners.comment: Close second on AW last time; gained sole success on this card two years ago; interesting
runners.spotlight: Spoiled his finishing effort by hanging at Chelmsford (7f, AW) last time but went down by only a neck and now goes in first-time headgear, which may well help; gained sole success in the novice event on this card two years ago; interesting back here.

runners.name: Izzari
runners.comment: Successful in Sunday Series event at Musselburgh five weeks ago; may improve further
runners.spotlight: Successful in Sunday Series event at Musselburgh (1m) five weeks ago on seasonal debut, adding to his December AW win (7f); connections evidently have the bonus in mind; has low mileage and may well improve further; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: The Bitter Moose
runners.comment: Form has dipped sharply this term for new yard; yet to win on turf
runners.spotlight: Has developed a habit of starting slowly; scored twice on AW in 2023 for previous yard; form has dipped sharply this term for new stable and latest defeat took his turf record to 0-12.

runners.name: Be Frank
runners.comment: 0-6 for current yard but ran well (close fourth off 7lb higher) over C&D last September
runners.spotlight: Two wins for previous yard; 0-6 for current stable but ran well (close fourth off 7lb higher) over C&D last September; attractively handicapped on seasonal debut and market support should be heeded.

runners.name: Reigning Profit
runners.comment: Bids for a hat-trick; now on career-high mark but is hard to dismiss in current form
runners.spotlight: Well suited by 5f; looked better than ever at Ripon nine days ago, following up his Pontefract win and taking record to 8-55; now on career-high mark but is very hard to dismiss in current form.

quotes.race: Welcome Racing TV Members Handicap
quotes.quote: Reigning Profit was a bit slower away than we'd hoped but it worked out well in the end. He likes it here - Ruth Carr, trainer.

quotes.race: Ripon Races Ladies Day 22nd June Handicap
quotes.quote: He did it well. Reigning Profit broke very quickly so I travelled strongly through the race and I think he was just getting a little tired near the line - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Go Racing In Yorkshire Future Stars Apprentice Handicap (Round 3)
quotes.quote: Reigning Profit is usually a good eater and he's a solid sprinter so I see no reason why he shouldn't go to Goodwood on Friday - Ruth Carr, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A solid sprinter who had a busy 2024 running 20 times, scoring at Wolverhampton and Hamilton and finishing runner-up four times. A turning track over 5f suits him best. There's a race for him at Pontefract on April 14. 09-04-25

runners.name: Sanat
runners.comment: Narrowly beat Spirit Of Applause at Nottingham last weekend, taking 5f record to 2-4
runners.spotlight: Disappointing on penultimate start; bounced back and narrowly beat Spirit Of Applause at Nottingham last weekend, taking record over 5f to 2-4 and overall strike-rate to 3-10; raised only 2lb and may remain competitive.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to us having had only five starts. He won on his most recent outing at Nottingham for Roger Varian. Back in May, he was the last horse off the bridle in a Doncaster novice won by Kind Of Blue and that run really grabbed our attention. Since then he's had two starts in handicaps and done nothing wrong. Although he won by only a neck at Nottingham, we thought he had a lot in hand, particularly with the way he went through the race. He's going to be gelded and he'll be ready to run early in the new year. He's a well-bred horse with a lot of sprinters in his pedigree. Giving him a little bit of time should see him progress further. 26-09-24

runners.name: Zarzyni
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Justified favouritism at Musselburgh last time; remains well treated on historical data
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism at Musselburgh (5f) four weeks ago, building on his eyecatching penultimate effort which came in a Sunday Series contest there; ties in with Knicks; still fairly useful at the age of eight and remains well handicapped on historical data.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: It worked out well. I haven't a clue why Zarzyni won there, we've tried everything with him. He's very smart, but I don't think the horse knows he's won. If he had time to think he'd have got beaten. He's a handy type to have in the yard as he's a very good work horse. When we have sprinters we have to work, he's the boy. We're thankful he's won and Musselburgh's been a lucky place for us -  oint-trainer David Barron, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Zarzyni is very straightforward and had been working well. For one of ours to win first time is always a good sign. We thought he was up to winning a maiden but not necessarily first time - Michael Halford, trainer.

runners.name: Jacquelina
runners.comment: Very productive last May/June; subsequent form leaves a lot to be desired
runners.spotlight: Highly productive spell last May/June included five wins; not in anything like the same form in three runs (October/April) since and needs to stage a big revival.

quotes.race: Trade Centre UK Handicap
quotes.quote: I can't believe the amount Jacquelina has improved. It's kind of by default that she has because she ran on the heavy ground at Windsor and we didn't think she'd like it, but since she's run on soft ground she's just improved. To go and win like that today under a double penalty was pretty impressive. I wake up at about 8st 6lb and this saddle is about 2st! She's got an entry at Hamilton on Thursday but there's also a couple of options at Thirsk for her - Grace McEntee, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Spirit Of Applause
runners.breeder: S Von Schilcher & Catridge Farm Stud
runners.comment: Steadily back to form this term; ties in closely with Sanat on latest effort
runners.spotlight: Record is 4-33; steadily back to form this term, most recently beaten only a head by Sanat at Nottingham last weekend; that effort suggests he's on his way to regaining the winning thread.

quotes.race: Constant Security Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Spirit Of Applause is a very strong-travelling horse and when he hits the front he just does enough. When he puts his best foot forward he's very effective - Sean Kirrane, jockey.

runners.name: Spring Bloom
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox
runners.comment: Well suited by Newmarket and looks interesting off a handy mark returned to this venue
runners.spotlight: Best effort this season when second at Goodwood on penultimate start; well suited by Newmarket, having been successful over C&D two years ago and on the July course (6f; twice) in 2024; interesting off a handy mark returned to this venue.

runners.name: Fletchers Flight
runners.comment: Record of 4-14 overall and 2-4 over 5f; lost chance with poor start last time
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-14 overall and 2-4 over 5f; lost chance with a poor start at Ascot most recently, failing to back up his reappearance effort (6f); capable of being involved, provided he gets away on terms.

runners.name: Knicks

prev_owners.owner: Capla Development, J Nordoff, L Westwood

runners.comment: Went very close in Sunday Series event at Musselburgh on penultimate start; respected
runners.spotlight: Successful off 1lb higher at Chester last May; 0-10 since but went very close in Sunday Series event at Musselburgh (again over 5f) on penultimate outing; Lewis Chalkley gets on board for first time, taking off a handy 7lb; respected.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk Saddle-Up For More Than Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't give Joanna any instructions, we just wanted to see what the drop back was going to do and it seems to have worked. It's Epsom next next, that's the plan - the three-year-old only Dash, because it's easier to win! - David Easterby, joint-trainer of Knicks.

runners.name: Spring Is Sprung
runners.comment: Has become attractively handicapped, having gained last two wins off this mark
runners.spotlight: Record is 4-24; below par in both runs this season but has become attractively handicapped, having gained last two wins (both last June) off this mark; good chance provided he's back on song.

stable_tour.quote: He's now won his last two at Pontefract and then at Lingfield last Thursday. His work has always been good and he finished fourth at York in a big-field handicap last season. But he then went wrong and we only ran him three times in all last year. He had to have time off and then he had a wind op during the winter. He's slowly run himself into form this season. Archie Young has won on him twice now and gave him an excellent ride at Pontefract. Both the horse and jockey had to be tough at Lingfield last time and they got the job done. I'd like to think there's be a little bit more to come from him. Whether he gets the hat-trick up depends on how good his trainer is. 28-06-24

runners.name: Merrimack
runners.comment: Form dipped when returned to turf last weekend and this is a better grade
runners.spotlight: Dual winner in Class 6 on turf and has made the frame several times in Class 5 on AW; form dipped when returned to this sphere last weekend and he now goes in Class 4; others preferred.

runners.name: Saariselka
runners.comment: Has a solid record (3122) and progressive RPRs; ties in with She's The Duchess; player
runners.spotlight: Solid record (3122) and progressive RPRs over 6f/7f; ties in closely with She's The Duchess on Yarmouth reappearance running; gives the impression she'll stay this new trip; likely player.

stable_tour.quote: I think she's a well-handicapped filly. She's big and done very well from two to three. I'm pretty sure she'll stay 1m and I hope she could be a filly for the Sandringham at Royal Ascot. 16-04-25

runners.name: Naina
runners.comment: Scored four times last summer/autumn but is far from solid on her subsequent form
runners.spotlight: Scored four times over 7f, including at the Newmarket tracks, last summer/autumn; far from solid on her subsequent form and takes on several unexposed types in this field.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF 'Jersey Lily' Fillies' Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Naina is well balanced and won a 20,000GBP seller on the July course so we knew she'd handle the track. She then went to Yarmouth and won again and loves this ground. She could well end up in a pattern race abroad - John Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: Shes The Duchess
runners.comment: Form figures read 122; ties in with Saariselka on latest effort; still unexposed
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated for second with Saariselka in Yarmouth handicap (stepped back up to 7f) last time, taking record to 122; parts of pedigree suggest she'll stay this new trip; still unexposed.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: She wasn't doing a lot in front. Obviously, it's her first start and she's still very green, but She's The Duchess has got a great attitude and did things nicely. There's a lot more filling out for her to do. She still rides a little bit weak, so with a little bit more time, I'd imagine that she can progress - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Magna Grecia Star
runners.breeder: Mountain View Stud & J C B/Stock
runners.comment: Solid record (312) over 7f; bred to be suited by this new trip; interesting
runners.spotlight: Solid record (312) over 7f, latest effort at Catterick switched to turf from AW; remains open to progress and should be suited by this extra furlong (half-sister to two 1m winners); interesting.

runners.name: Take A Breath
runners.comment: Justified favouritism at Doncaster on handicap/seasonal debut; the type to improve further
runners.spotlight: Haggas filly who justified favouritism at Doncaster (1m) two weeks ago on handicap/seasonal debut; looks the type to build on that success and show further improvement; respected.

runners.name: Lady Manzor
runners.comment: Possibilities, provided her 7f AW progress is transferred to this new scenario
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive over 7f on AW and took record to 3-5 with narrow success at Lingfield on Good Friday; possibilities, provided the improvement is sustained in this new scenario.

runners.name: Ryka
runners.comment: Seasonal debutante who needs a turnaround (has failed to back up debut win)
runners.spotlight: The only runner who lacks recent match practice (off since September) and needs a turnaround, having failed to back up the form of her debut win in two starts since.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Go-Racing-In-Yorkshire Summer Festival EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It's a nice starting place and we thought Ryka would run well, but she'll probably need further. She's done that really nicely, she's green as grass and will definitely come on a ton for it - Stewart Tosh, representing owners Akela Thoroughbreds.

stable_tour.quote: She won her debut on fast ground and then we pitched her into two stakes races on soft, but she didn't show up. We'll up her in trip on better ground as she has plenty of stamina in her family. She'll start off in handicaps with a view to going back into black-type races. 14-04-25

runners.name: Pacifist
runners.owner: Miss D Finkler, A Herd, Dr P Holloway 1
runners.comment: Not a particularly strong contender on form and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Has seemed a non-stayer in 1m2f events since handicapping but it's also possible that she just hasn't been good enough; the form of her 1m AW success isn't compelling.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Pacifist was very straightforward and galloped out all the way to the line. I think she could step up in trip going forward - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

3:45.race_name: Enter ITV7 For Free Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Fanjove
runners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster
runners.comment: 50,000gns yearling by Nando Parrado; trainer's 2yos are usually best watched at this stage
runners.spotlight: 16,000euros foal, 50,000gns yearling by Nando Parrado; third foal; half-brother to winners Wise Men Say (5f/7f including 2yo/Qatar) and Severa Sweety (Italian 6f/7.5f); dam well held at 5f as 2yo only start, half-sister to winners Nidhaal (6f 2yo Listed) and Maslak (useful 11.6f-1m6f); trainer's 2yos are usually best watched at this stage but he had one win in April last year.

stable_tour.quote: If you're looking for one for some instant gratification, he'll probably start over 6f and be out quite soon. His sire won the Coventry in 2020 at 150-1 on just his second start. 30-04-25

runners.name: Start Me Up
runners.comment: £210,000 yearling by Mehmas; yard had a 2yo justify favouritism on debut four days ago
runners.spotlight: £210,000 yearling by Mehmas; sixth foal; half-brother to five winners including Redemption Time (5f including 2yo/Bahrain; RPR 93), Twilight Romance (6f including 2yo; 91) and Private Island (7f/1m; 71); dam 6f-1m winner (including Listed; 105) out of French Oaks winner; yard (also runs You Sexy Thing) had a 2yo justify favouritism on debut four days ago.

runners.name: Treanmor
runners.comment: 2,000,000euros yearling; first foal; dam 6f 2yo/7f Listed winner (RPR 106); in a top yard
runners.spotlight: 2,000,000euros yearling; first foal; dam 6f 2yo/7f Listed winner (RPR 106), sister to 5f-1m winner Pedestal, closely related to 5f 2yo/6f winner Full Authority, half-sister to useful 7f/1m winner Oliver Show, out of half-sister to US 1m1f Grade 1 winner; this Frankel colt has to catch the eye.

runners.name: Vlad
runners.comment: 200,000gns yearling; eighth foal; half-brother to four fairly useful winners
runners.spotlight: 67,000gns foal, 200,000gns yearling; eighth foal; A'Ali half-brother to winners Entrusting (1m/1m2f; RPR 93), Prado (7f 2yo; 90), Royal Nation (1m including 2yo/Germany; 87) and Boafo Boy (6f-7.5f including 2yo; 83); dam Group-placed 6f winner (90); stable's 2yos have just got underway on the track.

runners.name: You Sexy Thing
runners.comment: 68,000gns buy; brother to 5f-1m winner Sex On Fire (including 2yo; RPR 90); yard runs two
runners.spotlight: 68,000gns yearling by Dark Angel; third foal; brother to 5f-1m winner Sex On Fire (including 2yo; RPR 90); dam 5f/6f winner (including Listed; 107), half-sister to three useful winners; yard (also runs Start Me Up) had a 2yo justify favouritism on debut under Jamie Spencer four days ago.

runners.name: Dontwaryboutathing
runners.comment: By Starman out of 1m2f winner; trainer had a fair 2yo win in April
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Starman half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Faisal Road (RPR 81); dam 1m2f winner (82), half-sister to 1m/1m2f Group 3 winner Hazapour, out of 1m4f Listed-winning half-sister to Derby/Irish Derby winner Harzand; trainer had a fair 2yo win in April.

3:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 8.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Tropical Island
runners.comment: Little doubt she'd have preferred rain; otherwise she resumes from a break on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: 2yo debut win (she also ran well on comeback last season) here came on soft ground and there's little doubt she'd have preferred some rain; otherwise she resumes from seven months off on a handy mark, having come 9lb down the weights last season.

runners.name: Greydreambeliever
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxv & E Burke
runners.comment: Pulled hard in front over 7f (Group 3) latest; has to prove she's up to this sort of mark
runners.spotlight: Well held at odds-on on her Polytrack comeback in March before another disappointing effort last time (Group 3), when giving herself no chance of seeing out 7f after pulling hard in front; now has to prove she's up to this sort of mark.

runners.name: La Rochette
runners.comment: Offered more over C&D latest but may not have the toe for an easy 6f in a small field
runners.spotlight: Often ran over 7f in France and her two 6f wins last spring came on heavy ground; offered more on her second run back, over C&D a month ago, but again whether she'll have the toe for an easy 6f in a small field is the question.

runners.name: Fluorescence
runners.comment: Needs more again now handicapping from the outside stall but remains unexposed; player
runners.spotlight: Beat an experienced odds-on favourite easily on her Tapeta debut last autumn and improved on that under a penalty on her Redcar comeback (6f, good to firm) early in the month; needs more again now handicapping from the outside stall but remains unexposed.

quotes.race: Start Racing TV Free Trial Now Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fluorescence is a lovely little filly who has a great attitude to life. She's obviously pretty quick and I'm looking forward to seeing what the handicapper does and seeing where I can go with her - Ed Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Mae Amor
runners.comment: Off the mark (at the expense of a subsequent winner) on Tapeta when last seen; considered
runners.spotlight: Off the mark (at the expense of a subsequent winner) over 6f on Tapeta when last seen six months ago; needs to improve now handicapping, switched from cheekpieces to a visor.

runners.name: Beaujolais Nouveau
runners.comment: Turned in a career-best effort on her recent C&D comeback; will rightly be popular
runners.spotlight: Closing Beverley win last autumn has been well advertised since and she turned in a career-best effort on her recent C&D comeback; the pair she came away with that day have let the side down since but she pulled hard and hit a bit of traffic, so will rightly be popular.

runners.name: Scatter Penny
runners.comment: Well held on Tapeta last time and is tried in first-time headgear off the back of it
runners.spotlight: Won her first two last summer before struggling in nurseries; failed to build on a fair comeback effort when well held on Tapeta last time and is now tried in first-time headgear off the back of it.

2:40.race_name: Hammond-Associates Yorkshire Spoon's 30th Raceday EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive)
2:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 8.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Anaisa
runners.comment: Landed Thirsk maiden 15 days ago; can progress further, especially up to 6f; big player
runners.spotlight: Ardad filly took a big step forward from her debut when landing 5f maiden at Thirsk 15 days ago, getting up late on; she can progress further, especially now stepped up to 6f; big player.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 'Gaffer Of All Accas' Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C & D) (GBB/IRE Incentive) (Div I)
quotes.quote: ANAISA\P ran okay first time, she ran very green here and she'll improve a fair bit - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Coparisi
runners.comment: Very green when debut ninth at Beverley; in good hands and can take a step forward now
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and very green when ninth of 12 in novice at Beverley (5f, good) on her debut last month; this daughter of Ardad is in good hands and can take a step forward now.

runners.name: Fast Generation
runners.comment: Mehmas filly is a sister to a fairly useful 5f winner so she must enter calculations
runners.spotlight: Mehmas filly is a sister to 5f 2yo winner Moving Force (RPR 92) and a half-sister to Listed-placed 6f/7f AW 2yo winner New Definition (RPR 95); dam 5f Listed winner (RPR 98); appeals on paper and in very good hands so she must enter calculations.

runners.name: Madame Colina
runners.comment: This daughter of Masar is one to consider, especially if the market vibes are positive
runners.spotlight: 2,000gns yearling; dam, 7f winner (RPR 95), is a half-sister to Raasel (prolific 5f Group 3 winner); this daughter of Masar can't be discounted, especially if the market vibes are positive.

runners.name: Oasis Diamond
runners.comment: Oasis Dream filly; the betting can prove a good indicator for this newcomer
runners.spotlight: 32,000gns yearling; Oasis Dream filly is a half-sister to winners Penelope Queen (Italian Listed-placed 5f; RPR 92), Torn (7f AW 2yo; RPR 86) and Tattoo (6f AW 2yo; RPR 72); dam, 6f AW 2yo winner (RPR 82), is a half-sister to multiple 5f winner Merry Banter; the betting can prove a good indicator for this newcomer.

runners.name: Spinning Lizzie
runners.comment: Kameko filly is a half-sister to five winners; considered newcomer; worth market check
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns foal; daughter of Kameko is a half-sister to five winners, notably Lambeth Walk (5f; RPR 96) and Pjanoo (1m; RPR 93); dam, 6f/7f winner (RPR 88), is a half-sister to dam of 1m Group 1 winner Mohaather; a considered newcomer who is worth a market check.

3:10.race_name: BBC York Georgey Spanswick Southern Belle Handicap
3:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 8.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Lincoln Rockstar
runners.owner: G P S Heart Of Racing Ltd & Partner

prev_owners.owner: G P S Heart of Racing (Bloodstock) Ltd

runners.comment: Looked rusty when last at Goodwood latest; five-time 2024 winner so can take step forward
runners.spotlight: Scored five times (around 1m4f) in 2024 but he looked rusty after eight months off when last of ten in 1m6f Goodwood handicap 16 days ago; he can take a step forward now.

quotes.race: Nelson Restaurant For Classic Raceday Dining Handicap
quotes.quote: We knew Lincoln Rockstar was really well but we weren't expecting that. She usually just does enough but she's put six behind them! She hit a flat spot during the race but we didn't expect she'd pick up in the way she did. She's entered at Musselburgh on Tuesday but we'll see how she comes out of this. We had a few races planned but the handicapper might take her off that. We'll have some fun with her - Ivan Furtado, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Titainium
runners.comment: Failed to last home over 1m4f when fifth at Thirsk latest; very much one to consider
runners.spotlight: Resumed with a good 1m2f Redcar second but he failed to last home on his first go over 1m4f when fifth at Thirsk last month; he's very much one to consider now reverted in trip.

runners.name: Cosmos Raj
runners.comment: Won at Hamilton latest when overcoming being held up off slow pace; C&D scorer and player
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort who resumed winning ways in 1m Hamilton handicap two weeks ago, overcoming being held up off a slow pace; up 2lb this C&D scorer is a player once more.

runners.name: Anjo Bonita
runners.comment: Beat only one for new yard at Wetherby three weeks ago; needs to take a big step forward
runners.spotlight: A fair 1m2f scorer in 2023 but she's been lightly raced since and beat only one after seven months off for her new yard in 1m2f Wetherby handicap three weeks ago; she needs to take a big step forward.

runners.name: Etretat
runners.comment: Fading seventh over 1m4f at Musselburgh last time; considered now back in distance
runners.spotlight: Kickstarted 2025 with success at Lingfield (1m2f) in January and he's continued in largely good form since, a fading seventh on his first go over 1m4f at Musselburgh last time; considered now back in distance.

runners.name: Spioradalta
runners.comment: In good form, fourth in 1m handicap here 22 days ago; considered off a 1lb lower mark
runners.spotlight: It's now 16 outings since his last victory but he's returned in good form, staying on into fourth in 1m handicap here 22 days ago; considered off a 1lb lower mark.

runners.name: Jez Bomb
runners.comment: Won at Thirsk and good sixth there since when not clear run; must enter calculations
runners.spotlight: Built on earlier promise when scoring at Thirsk (1m) in April and he backed it up with a good sixth of 15 in similar company there 15 days ago when also not enjoying the smoothest of passages; he must enter calculations.

runners.name: Poets Dawn
runners.breeder: Mrs J K Powell & Catridge Farm Stud
runners.comment: C&D scorer caught the eye when a running-on fourth there latest; interesting
runners.spotlight: Veteran C&D scorer caught the eye under a 7lb claimer when a running-on fourth of nine over C&D nine days ago; now figures 3lb below his last winning mark for his in-form yard; interesting.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: It felt like the leader was getting away but Poet's Dawn has a big heart and he dug deep. He's a grand horse to have in the yard, he goes on any ground and very versatile - David Allan, jockey.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: Poet's Dawn slipped coming out the stalls at Beverley last time and couldn't get in the race. He loves a bit of cut in the ground and David said he seemed to go better left-handed than right - Tim Easterby, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK In Glorious HD Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: The race that Poet's Dawn ran in at Redcar last time worked out quite well with several winners coming out of it, and this didn't look a particularly good race - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Timetobenice
runners.comment: Beat one at Southwell on final run for Marco Botti; needs yard switch to spark resurgence
runners.spotlight: On a losing sequence and he beat only one in 1m Southwell handicap in March on his final run for Marco Botti; he needs subsequent yard switch to spark a resurgence after a break.

4:10.race_name: On-Course Bookmakers Welcome You To Ripon Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
4:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 8.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Bradley Lane
runners.comment: Has the outside stall; the market will guide for a trainer who's 0-21 with runners here
runners.spotlight: Second foal of Boundary Lane, who won on her 3yo debut and again first time out as a 4yo; has been found an ordinary-looking novice for her debut and, from the outside stall, the market will guide for a trainer who's 0-21 with runners here.

runners.name: Eighth Avenue
runners.comment: First crack at sprinting back from ten months off; yard is 6-17 with runners here
runners.spotlight: Looked to find 1m beyond her when last seen but had previously been fine with 7f and this will be a first crack at sprinting, back from ten months off; yard is 6-17 with runners here down the years and the market should prove useful.

runners.name: Kennedys Pass
runners.owner: Mps Racing Ltd & The Ayrshire Tradesmen
runners.comment: 28-1, completely fluffed the start when tailed off on debut; needs to improve a deal
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to four winners; 28-1 for a similar novice at Redcar (7f) on her recent debut, when completely fluffing the start and finishing tailed off; needs to improve a deal on that.

runners.name: Monetize
runners.comment: Slowly away, said to have never travelled in a hood (off now) on comeback; risks attached
runners.spotlight: Inclined to pull hard last year and was tried in a hood on her 5f comeback a fortnight ago, when slowly away and said to have never travelled; the headgear is removed and she comes with risks attached.

runners.name: Pouting
runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl
runners.comment: Well backed on her comeback and sets the standard in first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Plenty of racing last year, when consistent aside from when out of her depth in Listed race at Newmarket; comeback third on Tapeta six weeks ago has been let down since but she was well backed and sets the standard in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Tanjen
runners.comment: 100-1 for a decent Doncaster novice on her debut last month, when making most; can improve
runners.spotlight: 100-1 for a decent 6f Doncaster novice on her debut last month, when making a lot of the running before fading; entitled to have learned from that and has landed the rail draw in a weaker race, so better can be expected.

4:40.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 8.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Copper And Five
runners.owner: Mrs Sally Doyle And Mrs Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Won at Beverley 13 days ago; up 2lb but C&D scorer is not taken lightly in current mood
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways in 8.5f handicap at Beverley 13 days ago; up 2lb but this veteran C&D scorer is not taken lightly in his current mood.

quotes.race: Supporting Weston Park Cancer Charity Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper and Five has been running quite keen in behind so we decided to just let him stride over a bit shorter and it suited him down to the ground, he's battled right to the line. My saddle slipped on the way to the start and we just re-saddled him at the start - Joanna Mason, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good old boy who carries condition and doesn't like having his ears touched! He wins most years, including three in 2021, and should win this year because he's well handicapped. A mark of 57 is as low as he's ever been. 09-04-25

runners.name: Mr Jetman
runners.comment: Beat only two in 8.5f Beverley handicap 24 days ago; the sort to bounce back though
runners.spotlight: On a long losing sequence and his run of good form came to an end when he beat only two in 8.5f Beverley handicap 24 days ago; the sort to bounce back though.

runners.name: Obee Jo
runners.comment: Looked rusty when ninth in Catterick h'cap six days ago; he can take a step forward now
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 out of sorts and looked rusty after five months off when ninth of 13 in 7f Catterick handicap six days ago but it would come as no surprise if he took a step forward now for his in-form yard.

quotes.race: "Irish Day" @thirskraces Saturday 18th May Maiden Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Obee Jo's a huge horse with a great temperament. He'll be a nice horse one day - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Spring Festival
runners.comment: Resumed with encouraging Pontefract third; merits serious consideration off same mark
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo resumed with an encouraging third of 11 in 1m Pontefract handicap 18 days ago; this son of Territories merits serious consideration in his bid for a maiden success off an unchanged mark.

runners.name: Panama City

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Susan Davis, Mrs Melissa O'Neill & Peter Mitchell

runners.comment: Back on track when fourth at Southwell 17 days ago; needs to back it up returned to turf
runners.spotlight: Got back on track when fourth of nine in 1m handicap at Southwell 17 days ago; he needs to back it up returned to turf now.

runners.name: Arranmore

prev_owners.owner: Ballylinch Stud & China Horse Club International Ltd

runners.comment: Returned with good third on Tapeta; C&D scorer can make his presence felt off same mark
runners.spotlight: Winless since 2021 but he returned from five months off with a good third of 12 in 8.5f Wolverhampton handicap 12 days ago; this C&D scorer can make his presence felt off the same mark.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Arranmore got a nice lead and when Cassy O came to me he dug deep. He's tough and genuine and he's going the right way - Shane Gray, jockey.

quotes.race: Matchbook Irish EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Kevin [Manning] said it was a bit of a messy race. They split into two groups and there was no pace on his side. The horse on his outside brought him over to be as one for the last three furlongs but there was nothing to bring him along quick enough. I'm sure he'll be stepped up in class. He's been unlucky to bump into a real good horse first time out and he got mugged at Naas on his outside last time. He deserved today and is a lovely horse for the future for connections. He's got a great attitude and is a beautiful horse to deal with - Ger Flynn, representative for Jim Bolger, trainer of Arranmore

runners.name: Annalee Lass

prev_owners.owner: Ms N Race And G Lavery

runners.comment: C&D winner; fair eighth at Wolverhampton last month; possibilities off an easing mark
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who comes here on the back of a fair eighth of 13 at Wolverhampton (8.5f) last month; possibilities off an easing mark.

runners.name: Fifty Sent
runners.comment: Won at Southwell; backed it up with respectable fourth there later in April; a possible
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run at Southwell (7f) in April and backed it up with a respectable fourth of 11 there 18 days ago; a possible.

runners.name: Curious Mrs Fox
runners.comment: Took a step forward when fifth at Pontefract latest; very much one to consider
runners.spotlight: Yet to register a victory but she took a step forward for her current yard when fifth of 11 at Pontefract (1m) 18 days ago, hampered 1f out; she's very much one to consider despite being 1lb out of the handicap.

runners.name: Top Gun Tina
runners.comment: Is 0-17 but she arrives in decent nick; she can't be totally discounted
runners.spotlight: Is 0-17 but she arrives in decent nick, seventh in 1m handicap at Pontefract 18 days ago; she can't be totally discounted.

runners.name: Selbys Joy
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with a solid Musselburgh fourth in October; needs to hit the ground running
runners.spotlight: Seems a poor maiden but she signed off for 2024 with a solid fourth of 11 in 1m Musselburgh handicap in October; she needs to hit the ground running on her return though.

2:10.race_name: Sterne Properties Supporting Yorkshire Wooden Spoon Apprentice Handicap
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 8.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Another Baar
runners.comment: Third over 7f on seasonal debut but two lesser efforts followed (7f/1m); risky back at 5f
runners.spotlight: Ran well when third on last month's seasonal debut (7f) but two lesser efforts have followed; has form over sprint trips but his recent habit of starting slowly makes him a risky option back at 5f.

runners.name: Glory Hyde
runners.comment: Third off 2lb higher at Wetherby last month and also ran well on latest outing; big player
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with third off 2lb higher at Wetherby (5.5f, good to firm) last month, form that has been very well advertised by the winner since, and she was not discredited from wide stall in recent Class 4 contest at Beverley (5f, good to firm); sure to appreciate this ease in grade; good chance.

runners.name: Sergeant Mayer
runners.comment: In-form 4yo who scored off 3lb lower at Redcar this month; respected
runners.spotlight: In good form in the autumn and has continued the good work since returning last month from a break, most recently when scoring at Redcar (5f, good to firm) 17 days ago; ought to be right in the thick of things again.

runners.name: Thornaby Pearl

prev_owners.owner: Ingleby Bloodstock And Tall Trees Racing

runners.comment: Ended last season in good heart but would appeal more on slower ground
runners.spotlight: Won over 5f when fresh last spring (soft ground) and was placed off today's mark on his final two starts in the autumn (both 6f, soft); runs this track well but may find 5f on good ground a bit sharp nowadays.

stable_tour.quote: A grand horse who wins once or twice every year. He could arguably win a few more. He has a high head carriage and is a real bridle horse. He travels strongly and when he gets his own way, he looks impressive. But then he gets handicapped accordingly and finds it very hard. He doesn't like the hustle and bustle, so getting out in front helps him. He likes cut in the ground - he won impressively at Doncaster in March in those conditions - and hopefully he'll be winning again. 26-07-24

runners.name: Herakles
runners.comment: Yet to strike form this season but scored over C&D off 6lb higher last June
runners.spotlight: Yet to hit form after three runs this year but now 6lb lower than when winning in pretty good style over C&D (good) last June; can't be ruled out.

stable_tour.quote: He's been great. He had a wind op and then won at Newcastle in January. He's pretty solid and pretty consistent. His Ripon win last time was a career-best and I'm hoping he'll progress as he gets stronger. I'd be amazed if he lasted all summer as he had a winter campaign, but he'll have a break at some stage and that could well be the making of him. He's a big, tall horse and hopefully he'll grow into something better than he is at the moment. 28-06-24

runners.name: Brian The Snail
runners.owner: The Brian The Snail Racing Club
runners.comment: Swooped late for 6f AW win last month; will need a strong pace to aim at over 5f
runners.spotlight: Habitual slow-starter who swooped late to score at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) three weeks ago; this veteran can be rather frustrating, though, and will need a strong pace to aim at over today's trip.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is an old boy who knows the game. Sometimes he breaks out a bit slow - like he's done today - but he thrives being hung onto and it's paid off - Ryan Kavanagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Unibet 3 Uniboosts A Day Handicap
quotes.quote: We got a good tow and Brian The Snail battled all the way to the line. On his day he is very good and proved that tonight - Jack Garrity, jockey

quotes.race: Heed Your Hunch At Betway Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a horse with a lot of ability, but he only ever does it every now and again. His work at home is better than what he shows in the afternoon, but when he puts his best foot forward he's a nice horse - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Owlerton Greyhound Stadium Sheffield Handicap
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail had a wind operation during the winter but his first run back was inconclusive as he didn't handle the track at Epsom. He might get into the Wokingham now - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Westow Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: That was too bad to be true, Brian The Snail never ran a race - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Racing UK Anywhere Available Now Handicap
quotes.quote: I was delighted with that. Brian The Snail is quite chunky so we wanted to get a run into him. I've made no secret, we do like him and there is a race at Ascot on May 3 for three-year-olds for him. We have the Commonwealth Cup in mind - Richard Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: catterickbridge.co.uk Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a good horse. I was a bit worried about the trip -  5f on a sharp track like this - but he's done it well. He'll be a sprinter - Tony Hamilton, jockey.

quotes.race: Book Your 17th October totepool Package Median Auction Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Brian The Snail is a grand, laid back horse and it took Tony (Hamilton) a while to pull him up there. He had done everything very easily at home and he had a really good blow so he will come on plenty for that. He is a horse we like a lot and it will be a surprise if he doesn't go on to better things - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Arlington
runners.comment: Made all on AW this month but recent 8lb rise asks quite a lot of him here
runners.spotlight: Bounced back from a disappointing run when making all for clearcut success off lowly mark at Southwell (5f, AW) this month; did that in a pretty good time for the grade but, nevertheless, recent 8lb rise asks quite a lot of him here.

runners.name: Canaria Queen
runners.comment: Close third at Catterick on Monday and remains very well handicapped on 2024 form
runners.spotlight: Bettered satisfactory seasonal debut when close third of 15 at Catterick (5f, good to firm) on Monday; remains very well handicapped on some of last year's form and good ground or softer will be in her favour.

5:10.race_name: Racing Welfare Mental Health Awareness Week Handicap
5:10.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 8.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Barmyblade
runners.comment: 7lb rise will make things tougher but he's better drawn today and goes on the shortlist
runners.spotlight: Poor last year but much improved this spring and appreciated the step back up from 5f when having two of these behind over C&D nine days ago; 7lb rise will make things tougher but he's better drawn today and goes on the shortlist.

runners.name: Causin A Commotion
runners.comment: Exposed now and will need to better his AW work if he's to take this from a wide stall
runners.spotlight: Kept exclusively to Tapeta since handicapping and has been given two months off after a below-par effort; exposed now and will need to better his AW work if he's to take this from a wide stall.

runners.name: Hype Merchant
runners.comment: The return to sprinting may suit for his new yard having been picked up for 3,500gns
runners.spotlight: Maiden who's had his chances in some low-grade AW handicaps for David Loughnane this year; can pull hard and this return to sprinting may suit, switched to cheekpieces from blinkers, for his new yard having been picked up for 3,500gns.

runners.name: Lima Sierra
runners.comment: Found traffic behind Barmyblade here last time; warrants respect on 8lb better terms
runners.spotlight: One of a few to pull hard and find trouble in a messy race behind Barmyblade over C&D nine days ago; has not been beaten far in any start since handicapping and is 8lb better off with the winner, which entitles her to at least close the gap.

runners.name: Sanbona
runners.comment: Showed plenty of dash since returned to sprinting in the visor and is better drawn today
runners.spotlight: Has twice shown plenty of speed since dropped from 1m and fitted with a visor, each time from wide stalls; fared better on that front today and needs considering.

runners.name: Lady Diesel
runners.comment: Ordinary debut for new connections late last month, when behind Sanbona and Ziva's Star
runners.spotlight: Didn't progress for Tom Ward and made an ordinary debut for new connections late last month, when behind Sanbona and Ziva's Star; it's hard to find a reason why she'll turn things round.

runners.name: Kilo Sunshine
runners.comment: Has not shown much in five starts; first headgear will need to make quite a difference
runners.spotlight: Has not shown much in five starts, latterly when well behind two of today's rivals over C&D nine days ago; first-time headgear will need to make quite a difference.

runners.name: Zivas Star
runners.comment: Better drawn than Sanbona when behind him at Redcar and is only slightly better off today
runners.spotlight: Bit more this year, having undergone wind surgery, but that's not saying much; she was better drawn than Sanbona when behind him at Redcar last time and is only slightly better off today.

runners.name: Twilight Poppy
runners.comment: Will need to have improved during her eight months on the sidelines
runners.spotlight: 7f looked to stretch her on the AW when last seen but she'd previously looked exposed as ordinary; will need to have improved during her eight months on the sidelines.

runners.name: Queens Palace
runners.comment: This is more realistic now handicapping but best to see support before considering her
runners.spotlight: Beaten some way in her three runs (5f-7f), the past twice at triple-figure prices; this is more realistic now handicapping but best to see support before considering her.

3:20.race_name: Bet With William Hill On Course Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
3:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Almazhar Garde
runners.comment: Made all off much reduced mark last month; 5lb rise is manageable if he's in the same mood
runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer who was very useful in his prime and exploited much reduced mark when making all at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) last month; it's hard to tell whether this race will pan out as favourably for him but he'll be fine on the quicker ground and a 5lb rise ought to be manageable.

quotes.race: Crest Hotels Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Almazhar Garde has been a fantastic horse for us and Paul's always got on really well with him. He'll run through the summer and hopefully he can pick up another win, or two - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has been very unlucky this season as he's been second in both the Southern and North Yorkshire Nationals, having just been touched off last time over 3m6f. We had been looking at Cheltenham next month, but I think we might leave him this year as he's a long-term Grand National hope. He's in great heart and we're looking at something like the Grimthorpe at Doncaster, or if he missed that the Midlands National would be a nice target. 09-02-22

runners.name: Ballybegg
runners.comment: Went close over hurdles two runs ago but this inconsistent 10yo seems best on slow ground
runners.spotlight: Went close over hurdles at Ludlow (2m5f, good) in March but this inconsistent and steadily regressive 10yo was not quite in the same form on his latest outing and has done all his winning ground slower than good.

quotes.race: Simply Delicious Cakes Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: As Ballybegg has got older he's got a bit better and his own way of jumping fences. It's great to win another with him. The ground's sticky, hard work, but he's won well on it. He's a horse with ability which makes it easier - Richard Patrick, jockey.

quotes.race: In Memory Of David Thomas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: BALLYBEG travelled really well, I was always taking a pull out of him. He was never happy over fences but as soon as he'd jumped the first I knew he was back to what he was last season. Fair play to Kerry (Lee) and the team to put the blinkers on and switch him back to hurdles - Richard Patrick, jockey.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We'll have to seriously consider the Ballymore, as long as there's some cut in the ground. He really enjoyed this soft ground. Ballybegg is a very nice horse. I don't know how good he is but the runner-up is a very decent horse on his day and clearly ran a very solid race. It was a very nice performance - Kerry Lee, trainer.

quotes.race: Foxtrot Racing Thrill Of Ownership Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was very impressive. Ballybegg's form from Bangor was solid as the winner [Minella Drama] looks a good horse. We fancied him today. It's real testing ground, I could hear them around me turning in so I gave him a squeeze and I couldn't believe how clear he'd gone and how easily he'd put the race to bed in a few strides. He's an absolute joy to have in the yard. He travels so well so he probably wants a bit further. He's handled the soft fine. He couldn't have done anything better today. I'd say he'll get better over a fence so there's a lot to look forward to - Richard Patrick, rider.

runners.name: Nickelforce
runners.comment: Off since below-par run in December but made very good start to chasing career in autumn
runners.spotlight: Won readily over C&D (good) on chasing debut in September and followed up at Ludlow (2m4f, good) in October; absent since slightly disappointing run in December but could still have untapped potential over fences.

quotes.race: Racing To School Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Nickelforce is such a good jumper. With amateur races it's tricky but Charlie [Case, jockey] knew the horse, so that was an added bonus. He's something to look forward to - Linda Lovell, part-owner.

runners.name: Baskerville
runners.comment: Just 1-8 over hurdles but has ground to suit on chasing debut; no surprise if he features
runners.spotlight: Just 1-8 over hurdles but gave fairly good account when last in action five weeks ago and is suited by good ground; tries a new trip on this chasing debut (best hurdle run was over 2m5f); interesting to see how he fares.

stable_tour.quote: I was very pleased with his second at Hereford last month - he did everything right bar win under a good ride by Oscar Palmer. He wouldn't want deep ground but he should win again over hurdles this winter and could be quite an exciting novice chase prospect for the spring. He wants 2m3f to 2m5f at the moment. 07-11-24

runners.name: Climbing

prev_owners.owner: HM The Queen & The Late Sir Chips Keswick

runners.comment: Ran big race in defeat at Hereford last month and is also suited by this track
runners.spotlight: Quite lightly raced 7yo who has pretty solid record in good-ground contests over fences; scored at Kempton (2m4f) in the autumn and ran big race in defeat at Hereford (3m1f) last month, after a break; also suited by this track; good chance.

2:20.race_name: Racing Welfare Supporting Mental Health Awareness Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
2:20.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Batsman
runners.comment: Won a point bumper in early 2024 but has struggled on all three starts under rules
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to stable's Gold Cup winner Coneygree; won good-ground point bumper by 5l in January 2024 but has struggled on all three starts under rules, most recently when pulled-up 100-1 shot in 2m3f Doncaster maiden in March.

runners.name: Blue In The West
runners.comment: 0-11 over hurdles; best form puts him in the mix here but he's tricky to predict
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles in Ireland; good second of 15 in Tramore handicap (2m5f, heavy) on New Year's Day but that performance was very much a standout last season and he's not easy to predict on this stable debut.

runners.name: Woodythewoodpecker
runners.comment: Struggled on first two hurdling starts but recent Ffos Las fourth was much better
runners.spotlight: From a very good jumping family; struggled in two slow-ground maiden hurdles in February (2m6f/2m3f) but took huge step forward and belied triple-digit odds wen very respectable fourth at Ffos Las (2m4f, soft) last month; has strong claims here if he handles the quicker conditions (ran okay in a good-ground bumper last spring).

runners.name: All Inn Hand
runners.comment: Placed C&D maiden in October; returns here after two decent efforts in Chepstow handicaps
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles last season but was placed in C&D maiden in October and kept on well for second in Chepstow handicap (2m7f, good) in first-time tongue-tie last month; didn't run badly when back at Chepstow in first-time cheekpieces three weeks ago; ought to play a major role in this.

runners.name: Dusky Spyglass
runners.comment: Not disgraced on recent stable debut but needs significant further improvement
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when fifth of seven against other mares on recent stable debut at Fontwell (2m5f, good; first-time hood) but needs significant further improvement here.

4:25.race_name: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Mares' Handicap Chase
4:25.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Irish Lullaby
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat and a dual hurdle winner; not bred for fences but trip/ground will suit
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat when based in Ireland and 2-7 over hurdles for current stable; not bred for fences but returned from break with a pretty good effort last month and will be suited by the trip/ground on this chasing debut; cheekpieces refitted.

stable_tour.quote: We ran her back too quickly last time; she needs time between her races. She did a really nice piece of work on Tuesday morning. 16-06-23
She wants a really strongly run two-mile handicap on good ground, but when she ran at Aintree the other day they went no gallop. She's a 94-rated Flat horse, so she's got a lot of ability. 21-11-24

runners.name: Fancy Stuff
runners.comment: Won this race easily under Sean Bowen last year; will be dangerous if back on song
runners.spotlight: Struck form last spring, winning this race easily under Sean Bowen before doubling up at Bangor (2m4f, good) a few weeks later; looked badly out of sorts on her two outings in the autumn but significant positives can be drawn from her recent reappearance run (albeit she was well beaten in the end), and she'll be dangerous if back on song.

runners.name: Kate Of The Lodge
runners.comment: Made quite promising chase/handicap debut over 2m; this longer trip ought to suit
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground Irish point winner in spring 2024; did not show a great deal in three slow-ground maiden hurdles last season (2m-2m4f) but made quite promising chase/handicap debut when third of six at Taunton (2m, good) in March and ought to be suited by this move back up in trip.

runners.name: Miss Applejack
runners.comment: Ran quite well over hurdles last month but others have more pressing claims here
runners.spotlight: Placed on the Flat since winning over hurdles in first-time cheekpieces at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) in December and ran quite well when back over hurdles last month; has headgear refitted for this chasing debut but others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Annie Nail
runners.comment: Won easily at Fakenham this month, her second stable start; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Safely held on last month's stable debut but rewarded strong market support when winning easily at Fakenham (2m5f, good) 12 days ago; the value of that form is open to question but, nevertheless, she needs to be taken very seriously off a 7lb higher mark here.

quotes.race: Alan Boswell Group Mares' Handicap Chase (Queen Boudicca Mares' Chase Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Annie Nail has been a fantastic little buy and is a really tough mare. I couldn't watch the race after the first circuit - the nerves got the better of me - but having watched the replay she travelled brilliantly and won well. She shaped encouragingly at Hereford on her first start for us and we were confident coming into this - Tracey Leeson, trainer.

2:50.race_name: William Hill More Top Prices Mares' Handicap Hurdle
2:50.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.3) (Watering)

runners.name: Summerleaze
runners.comment: 3-3 and a much improved mare for new stable this spring; commands respect
runners.spotlight: 3-3 and a much improved mare for new stable this spring, the latest win gained by 14l here (2m6f, good) ten days ago; tries a new trip today and could still have more to offer; commands respect.

runners.name: Portobello Girl
runners.comment: Low-mileage 6yo; suited by step up to 2m7f when keeping-on second at Uttoxeter this month
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who looked suited by the step up to 2m7f when keeping on well for second at Uttoxeter (good) a fortnight ago; moves up in trip again today and can make her presence felt.

runners.name: Bright Sunbird

prev_owners.owner: M Hammond, Moorland Racing & J Menzies

runners.comment: Not at best for new stable this spring but has a good-ground C&D win on her record
runners.spotlight: C&D winner for Gary Hanmer in summer 2023 and placed for Rebecca Menzies last year; not at best for new stable this spring but wasn't beaten far on either occasion and returns to this track on a tempting mark.

quotes.race: bet365 Mares' Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Bright Sunbird had run really well the last twice and we thought she had a good chance. She stuck to the task nicely and was very genuine - Tabitha Worsley, jockey.

runners.name: Shibuya Song
