runners.spotlight: Five-time 6f scorer but showed his ability to last this far when 2.25l third three weeks ago; placed in four of his last five so must be on the shortlist.

runners.name: Joyful Prosperity
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Silas S S Yang & Michelle H Y Yang
runners.comment: Went up 20lb for three wins; unplaced in five starts since; only 1lb above winning mark.
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row late last year but has paid a heavy price in the weights as a result and maybe lost some confidence; now just 1lb higher than for latest win.

runners.name: Volcanic Spark
runners.comment: Has lost his way a little this year; narrow C&D February defeat shows he can be dangerous.
runners.spotlight: Has been placed just once in nine starts since winning off today's mark over C&D ten months ago; needs to bounce back to form.

runners.name: Youth Power
runners.comment: Landed fourth career win (from 28 runs) over C&D last time; up 7lb with apprentice booked.
runners.spotlight: Upped 7lb for his 1.5l C&D victory (with three of today's rivals behind) but weight rise is negated by using an apprentice here; all-or-nothing performer (four wins and no places from 28 starts).

runners.name: Ace War
runners.comment: Has been disappointing since arriving from Britain apart from one third place over C&D.
runners.spotlight: Eight of his nine Hong Kong runs have been poor but repetition of the other (C&D 2l third off 4lb higher in March) would give him a squeak.

quotes.race: Harrison College Your Future Your Choice Handicap
quotes.quote: King Of Spain is a half-brother to Mostly Cloudy we bought as a yearlong and he's probably got a better mind and is stronger physically than him. Given the pedigree, we did think he'd keep taking a big step forward between runs. His home work had been really strong since the Wolverhampton race, you could tell he'd really come forward. We thought the ground and trip would suit him but to see him do it in that fashion was really promising. He dug deep when the other horse came to him. We'd be keen to keep him off the quicker ground so he'll probably be quite busy now then have a bit of a break when the ground dries up - Gemma Tutty, trainer.

runners.name: Firefoot
runners.comment: Now 2lb lower than when finishing in front of six of these three starts ago; chance.
runners.spotlight: Had no less than six members of this field behind him when 1.75l fourth over 1m2f here in March and has posted two solid efforts since; merits consideration.

runners.name: Double Win
runners.owner: Dr Kelvin Chong Man Yuk & Ma Yuen Yu
runners.comment: 12-race maiden who was fourth in first-time blinkers four weeks ago; up from 1m.
runners.spotlight: Career record now reads 0-12; slight improvement in blinkers when 2l fourth of 12 four weeks ago (1m); could progress again over this longer trip.

runners.name: Gale Saga
runners.comment: Back to within 1lb of his latest winning mark but probably better over shorter.
runners.spotlight: Highly inconsistent but has turned by far his two best efforts (from 15 tries) into a pair of 7f victories; this trip looks to be further than ideal.

runners.name: S J Tourbillon
runners.owner: Ma Ren De & Dr Ma Yuen Yuen

prev_owners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Is becoming dangerously well handicapped and has not been beaten far in recent 1m1f runs.
runners.spotlight: Now 18lb below the mark off which he scored his latest victory (almost two years ago) and has been beaten by just 2l or so in each of his last two 1m1f runs; each-way player.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: he's been nurtured along so, I suppose, Group/Classic material is where they really want to end up. I'd be happy enough to say a mile is comfortable enough for him, maybe even back a furlong starting next year - Seamie Heffernan, jockey

runners.name: Kasa Papa

prev_owners.owner: Dynamic Syndications Racing, J R Carter Et Al

runners.comment: Inconsistent; capable of getting involved off this mark if putting his best foot forward.
runners.spotlight: In-and-out performer (one win and four places from 11 runs this season) and can be given a chance on his C&D neck second off a 1lb lower mark three starts ago.

runners.name: Musang King
runners.comment: Yet to really shine in five career outings; needs step up from 1m to bring progress.
runners.spotlight: Four poor efforts plus a 3.25l fifth over 7f from five career starts; unproven over further than 1m.

runners.name: All Are Mine
runners.comment: Has won off 6lb higher but yet to prove that he retains his old ability after an injury.
runners.spotlight: Landed a 1m1f dirt success off a 6lb higher mark in December 2023 but has not looked the same horse since returning from a year off five months ago.

runners.name: Escape Route
runners.comment: Has won off a 31lb higher mark than today's but looks like a shadow of his old self.
runners.spotlight: Four-time Hong Kong winner but his current winless streak now stretches back for over a year and he seems out of sorts; well handicapped if reviving.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Escape Route has shown a nice attitude. He was a little bit green early on, but he was drawn on the outside and needed time to find his feet. He's a bit backward but he's been going well at home and should improve a lot from that - Danny Tudhope, rider.

runners.name: Amazing Run
runners.comment: Out of form in his last four runs and all of his wins have been at 7f or shorter; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Began this season with five good runs, including a 7f win, but has lost his form badly in recent months; has never been tried over further than 1m.

runners.name: Circuit Mighty
runners.comment: Slightly improved last two runs but all his best form is at 7f; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Current win drought now runs to fully two years and this triple 7f scorer looks highly unlikely to stay 1m1f.

8:10.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Fun Elite
runners.comment: Dropped in class; Purton booked for the first time; good chance if 5f is not too short.
runners.spotlight: Back down to Class 4 for the first time since a 6f win here on New Year's Day; has been running creditably in better company and booking of Purton is eye-catching, though may prefer 5f.

runners.name: Amazing Fun
runners.comment: Ready winner over C&D on debut but is returning from eight months so may lack fitness.
runners.spotlight: Looked a good prospect when making C&D winning debut 11 months ago but has not been seen since September and recent trials suggest that he may need the run here.

runners.name: Heroic Master
runners.breeder: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co

prev_owners.owner: J W Kelly Suffolk Vale & Co

runners.comment: Would have sound claims on best recent form but on long win drought; ignored by Purton.
runners.spotlight: Both local wins have been off higher marks at Happy Valley and most recent was in 2023; placed four times this season but disappointed when dropped to Class 4 last time; deserted by Purton.

runners.name: Dancing Classics
runners.comment: Well-bred debutant; has suffered fitness issues over the past year; modest form in trials.
runners.spotlight: Full-brother to a triple sprint winner from a good Irish family but has had soundness issues since arriving in Hong Kong and beaten (two second places) in six recent trials; watching brief advised.

runners.name: Invictus Dragon
runners.comment: Won one of three local trial races; not ruled out despite likely need for longer trip.
runners.spotlight: AUS$200,000 breeze-up purchase whose grandam produced a Group 1 winner; won the second of three local trial races but less convincing last time and may prove best over further.

runners.name: Leading Article
runners.comment: Unfancied when 5.75l ninth on only start three months ago; beaten in three recent trials.
runners.spotlight: Has been absent for three months since cutting little ice as a 53-1 chance on his debut and recent trial race form is unconvincing.

runners.name: Watch The Fort
runners.comment: Bred to be fast but needs to step up on what he has achieved in seven local trial races.
runners.spotlight: Cost AUS$130,000 as a yearling and is a half-brother to a five-time sprint winner but has failed to make the top two in seven local trials and may need more time to mature.

runners.name: Thunder Blink
runners.owner: Cheung Yat Yuen & Yiu King Chuen
runners.comment: Started career with two wins here but highly disappointing in seven starts since.
runners.spotlight: Has lop-sided profile of two wins followed by seven heavy defeats (no better than ninth); hard to recommend until he shows signs of a revival.

runners.name: New Asia Great
runners.comment: First run since poor debut 11 months ago; won recent trial so should not lack fitness.
runners.spotlight: Suffered leg injury in November and has not run since last but one in C&D career debut 11 months ago; did win a recent trial and may have the speed to lead in a first-time hood.

runners.name: Beauty Formula
runners.comment: No encouragement in three very moderate runs thus far; now tries cheekpieces.
runners.spotlight: Has been sent off at 89-1 or bigget and run accordingly in all three starts to date; needs the addition of cheekpieces to make a huge difference.

runners.name: Island Breezes
runners.comment: Unreliable; 0-8 career record but has two bits of recent form that give him a solid shout.
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and still a maiden after eight attempts but close third in two of his last four starts (6f & 5f) is on a career-low mark here; cheekpieces replace blinkers.

runners.name: Fortune Racer
runners.breeder: Mrs A J Horne & B R Horne
runners.comment: Outsider when down the field in three runs; new trainer needs to have transformed him.
runners.spotlight: First run for a new trainer on return from sevn-month absence; has beaten a total of three rivals in three career starts to date (6f & 7f); dropping back to 5f.

runners.name: Noble Deluxe
runners.comment: Only real form from five starts when 2l third as big outsider over C&D two months ago.
runners.spotlight: Has run poorly in four out of five career start but repetition of 2l third when an 86-1 chance over C&D in March could see him make the frame.

runners.name: Bingo Babe
runners.owner: Charmaine Wong Kam Mei & Chan Fu Ho
runners.comment: Much his best effort was C&D 1.75l second in March but that was a poor race.
runners.spotlight: Only form from four tries was when second (just in front of Noble Deluxe) in what was probably a weak contest over this C&D on penultimate run.

runners.name: Cheval Valiant
runners.comment: Has won over C&D three times and is reasonably weighted; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner, including off exactly this mark in September; only beaten by 2l when sixth last time; fair claims if getting a place in the final field; reserve.

runners.name: Glorious Kingdom
runners.comment: Not in the top two in five local trial races so unlikely to make a winning debut; reserve.
runners.spotlight: AUS$50,000 yearling purchase who is the first foal of a mare who was placed over 7.5f; won a trial in Australia but has failed to sparkle in five local trials; reserve.

8:40.race_name: Hilltop In The Valley Handicap (Class 4) (3yo+) (Course C+3) (Turf)
8:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Aurora Patch

prev_owners.owner: Ms R A Fowler, M E Izatt & A R Davison

runners.comment: Placed twice in Class 3 this year; drops in grade with Zac Purton booked today
runners.spotlight: 0-7 in Hong Kong but placed twice over 5f here in February/March and was very respectable fifth over C&D last month; drops in grade and has the services of Zac Purton today; leading contender.

runners.name: Wonderstar
runners.comment: Won five times in Macau but is yet to be placed after 13 Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won five times in Macau but is yet to be placed after 13 Hong Kong starts; drops back to more suitable trip after blasting off too hard over 1m on dirt last week but still makes only limited appeal.

runners.name: Blazing Wukong
runners.comment: Has shown promise in recent trials but is probably best watched on this official debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a 6f/1m winner; has shown promise in recent trials but is probably best watched on this official debut.

runners.name: Come Fast Fay Fay
runners.breeder: Ms D M Cuthbert & P J Smith
runners.comment: Not beaten far on last month's debut (5f) having started slowly; a possible
runners.spotlight: Started slowly before staying on for very respectable seventh here (5f) on last month's debut; ought to have learnt from that experience and has possibilities over today's extra furlong.

runners.name: Handsome Blond
runners.comment: Struggled on last month's debut (6f, dirt); switched to turf today
runners.spotlight: Struggled on last month's debut (6f, dirt); needs this switch to turf to enable massive improvement.

runners.name: Jolly Companion
runners.comment: Dual dirt winner this season; on tough mark now and drawn wide for turf return
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f dirt winner under Britney Wong in early part of this season; seemingly in the grip of the handicapper since, though, and has double-digit draw for this turf return.

runners.name: Lucky Mcqueen
runners.comment: Drawn wide for this official debut but has won two 6f trials in recent weeks
runners.spotlight: Out of a once-raced maiden; drawn wide for this official debut but has won two 6f trials in recent months and evidently has significant ability; hood/tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Rainbow Seven
runners.owner: Jason Chow Hei Shing & Chow Yuk Yin
runners.comment: Outran triple-digit odds when second over C&D on recent debut; taken very seriously
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who outran triple-digit odds when keeping-on second over C&D on debut three weeks ago; needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: Runjeet
runners.comment: Made quite promising debut but his second run was very disappointing
runners.spotlight: Made quite encouraging debut when sixth from wide stall over C&D in March but last month's run here was very disappointing and it's hard to know what to expect from him today.

runners.name: Club Ace
runners.comment: Back on track with C&D third a fortnight ago and has each-way claims again
runners.spotlight: A maiden after seven starts but put two below-par runs behind him when keeping-on third over C&D a fortnight ago and has each-way claims again.

runners.name: Groovy Feeling
runners.owner: Dr Anthony W K Chow & Michael Tong Hing Yuen
runners.comment: Well down the field on both outings last month and has the outside draw today
runners.spotlight: Close third over C&D at 92-1 odds on debut in December but finished well down the field on both outings last month and has the outside draw.

runners.name: Elegant Life
runners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: R T Walker & S T Walker

runners.comment: Unplaced all 11 Hong Kong starts and not the most obvious answer
runners.spotlight: Never really looked dangerous when eighth over C&D last month and has now been unplaced all 11 Hong Kong starts; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: Circuit Century
runners.owner: Ho Yin Sang & Tsang Kin Wa
runners.comment: Out of a 5.5f winner; narrowly won a 6f dirt trial last month; official debut today
runners.spotlight: Out of a 5.5f winner; narrowly won a 6f dirt trial last month; will be making official debut if he gets a run today; blinkers fitted.

runners.name: Awesome Treasure
runners.breeder: A D, J D & Mrs L J E Scoular
runners.comment: Won over C&D in October but has looked badly out of sorts in recent months
runners.spotlight: Now 1lb lower than when winning over C&D in October but has looked badly out of sorts in recent months.

9:10.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Gummy Gummy
runners.owner: Alan Kiang Ping Fai & Joyce Lee

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Placed over C&D on last three appearances, twice losing out only by a short head
runners.spotlight: Without a win since June 2023 but placed over C&D on last three appearances, losing only by a short head on two of those occasions; obvious contender again today.

runners.name: Bundle Of Charm
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: Stretched by 1m last week; big player if judged on earlier 6f Class 2 form
runners.spotlight: Didn't see out 1m when dropped to this grade last week but has been competitive over 6f in Class 2 this season and is effective on dirt; one to consider.

runners.name: Mask Rider
runners.comment: Placed off today's mark since C&D win in January but has awkward draw today
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D on Hong Kong debut in January and has been placed off today's mark since but will need to find something extra to overcome double-digit draw today.

runners.name: Packing Bole
runners.comment: In good form over C&D this season and recent 5f turf defeat can be overlooked
runners.spotlight: Not seen to best effect when dropped to 5f on turf in March has been in good form over C&D this season, most notably when scoring off 6lb lower in December; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Victory Moments
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner last season but out of form this term; revival needed
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D last season but has been out of form this term and needs to turn things around.

runners.name: Master Champion

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Unlucky not to finish closer than eighth over C&D on recent HK debut; could have a say
runners.spotlight: Ended seven-race career in Australia with 6f maiden win last August and was unlucky not to finish closer than eighth over C&D on last month's Hong Kong debut; could have a say if that recent outing brought him on.

runners.name: Solid Shalaa
runners.comment: Up in grade after finishing well for C&D win last month; respected in current form
runners.spotlight: Close second over C&D in March, after a long layoff, and finished strongly to go one better here last month; moves up in grade today but has good draw and is respected in current form.

runners.name: Mojave Desert
runners.owner: James Lau Po Man & Alice Woo Wai See
runners.comment: Won over C&D on stable debut in December and still in good form; draw wide today, though
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D on stable debut in December and has largely remained in good form since; beaten under 1l when fifth off today's mark here last month but might be vulnerable from stall 12 today.

runners.name: Jolly Ruler
runners.comment: Won readily on turf in April but is back up in grade now and has wide draw for dirt return
runners.spotlight: Won readily on turf in Class 4 last month, exploiting some help from the handicapper, and made the frame when back up in this grade 11 days ago; also suited by dirt but has wide draw today and younger rivals appeal more.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings) (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Helmont has been doing a lot right at home and looked the part. I was pleased with how he went through the gap and he won like a nice horse - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: Mr Energia
runners.comment: Dual Class 4 winner this season; recent close fourth over C&D came in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Dual winner in Class 4 this season (once over C&D); has the inside draw today and proved he can be very competitive in this grade when finishing well for close fourth over C&D last month; a possible.

runners.name: Bright Day
runners.comment: Unable to land a telling blow on any of first eight Hong Kong starts; dirt debut today
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner when based in Macau (once on an AW surface) but unable to land a telling blow on any of first eight Hong Kong starts (6f-7f); makes dirt debut today.

runners.name: Warriors Dream
runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Stephen Ho Wai Man, F Ho Ka Chun & D Ho Ka Chung
runners.comment: Fair handicapper in Britain but has made a low-key start to his Hong Kong career
runners.spotlight: Fair 6f-1m handicapper for Sean Woods in Britain last year but has made a low-key start to his Hong Kong career on turf (three runs); dirt debut.

9:40.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Sugar Ball
runners.owner: Lau Po Keung, Yee Shun Hung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Carringbush Park, Miss K A Brideoake & Ms L S Dillon

runners.comment: Dips back into Class 4 after very respectable fifth over C&D last month; high on the list
runners.spotlight: Dual 6f course winner in early part of season and has held his own in higher-grade company since; dips back into Class 4 after very respectable C&D fifth last month; high on the list.

runners.name: With A Smile
runners.comment: Low-mileage 3yo who came good with C&D win last month; has more to offer; respected
runners.spotlight: Delivered on earlier 6f promise when keeping on well to score over C&D last month, his fourth start; drawn wide again today but probably still has more to offer; respected.

runners.name: Across Da Universe
runners.comment: Ran okay over C&D when dropped to this grade last month but well beaten since
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all seven Hong Kong starts; stayed on for fifth over C&D when dropped to this grade last month but was well beaten here a fortnight ago; others look much safer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Race (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Buyin Buyin was strong at the finish and looked like he might get another furlong. He was workmanlike rather than spectacular but I'll take it. Hopefully we might run him in the Anglesey Stakes in a couple of weeks. I think he deserves to go and whether he is good enough we're not sure - Willie Browne, trainer.

runners.name: Capital Legend
runners.comment: Recent efforts have been underwhelming; needs good boost from the new blinkers
runners.spotlight: Now 6lb lower then when scoring over 1m here in October but his recent efforts have been underwhelming and he needs a good boost from the new blinkers today.

runners.name: Quick Contribution
runners.comment: Unexposed 3yo who was placed over C&D when upped in trip last month; considered
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 3yo who looked suited by the step up in trip when placed over C&D last month; has the outside draw to contend with today but still makes appeal.

runners.name: Radiant Swift
runners.owner: Lam Shui Wah, Kung Man Kai & Wancy Wong Wan Sze
runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for last month's debut
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for last month's debut at Happy Valley (1m).

runners.name: Rattan Galaxy
runners.comment: Always towards rear when 87-1 for last month's debut (6f); no blinkers today
runners.spotlight: Always towards rear when 87-1 for last month's debut (6f); moves up in trip and goes without blinkers today.

runners.name: Sandman
runners.comment: Posed no threat when among the outsiders for last month's C&D debut
runners.spotlight: Posed no threat when among the outsiders for last month's C&D debut; swaps cheekpieces for blinkers today.

runners.name: Bull Attitude
runners.comment: Launched career with two fairly encouraging 6f runs from wide stalls; better drawn today
runners.spotlight: Launched career with two fairly encouraging 6f runs from wide stalls; needs improvement on this first 7f attempt but at least he's better drawn this time.

runners.name: Regency Win Win
runners.comment: Not disgraced on debut (6f, dirt) but well down the field over C&D on second start
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced on debut in March (6f, dirt) but finished well down the field over C&D last month (first-time cheekpieces); probably one for further down the line.

runners.name: Blazing Beam
runners.owner: Roger Chan Tse Man & Bosco Chan
runners.comment: Placed at big odds on debut in January but has not shown a great deal since
runners.spotlight: Belied triple-digit odds when placed over 6f on debut in January but has not shown a great deal over 6f/7f since.

runners.name: Sight Dreamer
runners.comment: This month's C&D run was underwhelming and he's now 0-5
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; has twice made the frame over 6f here but his C&D run a fortnight ago was underwhelming; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Dragon Sunrise
runners.owner: Sunny Wong Chi Tat & Wong Tsz Wah
runners.comment: Showed minor promise over C&D in March but soundly beaten over 1m since
runners.spotlight: Displayed some improvement when sixth over C&D in March, his fifth start, but did not get competitive when upped to 1m last month.

runners.name: World Hero
runners.comment: 6f Class 5 winner in March but safely held when back up in this grade last month
runners.spotlight: Off the mark with 6f Class 5 win here in March, his tenth start, but safely held when back in this grade last month and needs to kick on again.

runners.name: Forerunner
runners.owner: Ng Tai Wing, Anson Or Yiu Wah & Henry Yeung Mun Kin
runners.comment: Won cosily over C&D in January but has suffered worrying dip in form since
runners.spotlight: Ended long losing spell with cosy C&D win in January and was runner-up here on next outing but has suffered a worrying dip in form since.

runners.name: Ka Ying Glory
runners.comment: Flopped badly when odds-on for debut in March but remains a very interesting prospect
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to Hong Kong's superstar sprinter Ka Ying Rising; raced too freely and flopped badly when odds-on for debut in March (6f) but has looked very promising in trials and remains a good prospect; blinkers added.

10:15.race_name: Beas River Country Club Handicap (Class 3) (3yo+) (Course C+3) (Turf)
10:15.going_detailed: DIRT: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO FIRM

runners.name: Triumphant More
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Julian Chow Kai Wo,Chow Wing Shuen & Chow Cheuk Wai
runners.comment: Triple 6f winner this season; didn't fire last time, though, and has awkward draw today
runners.spotlight: Progressive 4yo who has collected three 6f wins this season and still has low mileage; didn't fire last time, though, and has awkward draw to negotiate today.

runners.name: Young Superstar
runners.comment: C&D winner in November but out of form in recent months and still on fairly tough mark
runners.spotlight: Placed twice since C&D win in November but finished well down the field on last three outings and remains on a fairly tough mark.

runners.name: Moduleconstruction
runners.owner: Eddie Lam Kin Wing, Arthur Lam Chi Ping & M Lam Chi Min

prev_owners.owner: Mr & Mrs Eddie Lam Kin Wing, Arthur Lam Chi Ping & M L C Min
Eddie Lam Kin Wing, Arthur Lam Chi Ping & M Lam Chi Min
Eddie Lam Kin Wing & Arthur Lam Chi Ping
Eddie Lam Kin Wing, Conrad Fung Kwok Keung Et Al

runners.comment: Career-best form when winning over C&D last month; 6lb rise demands even more from him
runners.spotlight: Has worked his way back to form since belated seasonal debut in March and posted career-best performance when scoring over C&D last month; drawn wide again today, though, and 6lb rise demands even more from him.

runners.name: Pakistan Legacy
runners.comment: Placed on two of four HK starts; has much better draw that last time; must be considered
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over C&D on two of his four Hong Kong starts; kept on for very respectable fifth behind Moduleconstruction here last month and has much better draw today; must be considered.

runners.name: Super Infinity
runners.comment: Consistent sprinter who has the inside draw and ought to be on the premises
runners.spotlight: Consistent sprinter who drops back to 6f after fairly good attempt at 7f two weeks ago; holds no secrets from the handicapper but has the plum inside draw and ought to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Fortune Supernova
runners.breeder: T R Pascoe, Vicki Pascoe Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Angela Boyd, Chrissie Dalgety Et Al

runners.comment: Slightly disappointing last month but placed from stall 10 over C&D on HK debut in March
runners.spotlight: 5f winner in New Zealand; belied 58-1 odds when placed over C&D from double-digit draw on Hong Kong debut in March; slightly below that form last month but still enters calculations.

runners.name: All Round Winner
runners.owner: Clement Chan Kam Wing, Maggie Ho Sze Nga Et Al
runners.comment: Soundly beaten over C&D on first two Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten over C&D on first two Hong Kong starts and seemingly in need of some more weight off his back.

runners.name: Majestic Express

prev_owners.owner: B K Racing, Breeding Pty Ltd & B J Vasallo

runners.comment: C&D winner in October and still in good form; dangerous if he gets a good pace to aim at
runners.spotlight: Finished well for narrow C&D win in October and has remained in good form since; will be dangerous if he gets a good pace to aim at.

runners.name: Magic Hallow
runners.comment: Much improved form when second over 5f last month, his third HK start; up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on first two Hong Kong starts but kept on well to take second at triple-digit odds here (5f) last month and it will be interesting to see whether he can build on that performance over today's longer trip.

runners.name: Blazing Wind
runners.comment: Sound effort when fourth over C&D last month; headgear switched today; well drawn
runners.spotlight: Opened account with Class 4 C&D win in January and has held his own at this higher level since, most recently when fourth behind Moduleconstruction here last month; well drawn today and has a fighting chance if change of headgear has any positive effect.

runners.name: Solid Impact
runners.comment: Regressive 7yo who was well beaten over 7f here last month
runners.spotlight: Seemingly back in good form when third over 7f in January but has quickly gone off the boil again since; younger rivals have much more appealing profiles.

runners.name: Winning Data
runners.owner: Dr Steven Li Siu Lung, Cheng Lap Yin Et Al
runners.comment: Has found things tough since upped to this grade and his wins were over 7f/1m
runners.spotlight: Progressive in Class 4 this year, winning three times (7f-1m), but has found things tougher since upped to this grade and today's drop back in trip is not an obvious move.

runners.name: Eighty Light Years
runners.comment: Back in good form over 7f in recent months and can cope with this drop back to 6f
runners.spotlight: Runner-up twice over 7f in March/April and also ran well when fifth over that trip on latest outing; effective over 6f too and will warrant consideration if he gets a run today.

runners.name: Forza Toro
runners.comment: Comfortable winner of 6f AW maiden in Ireland in November; Hong Kong debut today
runners.spotlight: Built upon debut promise when comfortable winner of 6f AW maiden in Ireland in November; will be making his Hong Kong debut if he gets a place in the line-up today; tongue-tie added.
